pages.title: Private Provider Guidelines
pages.content: Private Provider Guidelines Notice: The Quality Assurance Minimum Guidelines   Private Providers was established for uniformity in applying the alternative plans review and inspection process throughout Miami-Dade County. Florida Statutes 553.791 (16)(b) states a local building official may establish, for private providers and duly authorized representatives working with that jurisdiction, a system of registration to verify compliance with the licensure requirements of paragraph (1)(n) and the insurance requirements of subsection (17). Please review the steps below and reach out to our office if you have any questions. ALERT: If electing to use a Private Provider for your project, please review your permit invoice before paying it to ensure appropriate discounts have been applied. Discounts are applied on the base permit fees only. Step 1 Review "Private Provider" Registration Guidelines Private Provider Registration Guidelines Update your Private Provider Registration annually. See the  Contractor Registration  page for more information. See the  Videos & Tutorials  page for creating user logins in the permitting system. Every authorized team member should have their own unique login. Multiple contacts can be added to one  Private Provider Company  as subcontracts. Step 2 Review "Private Provider" Plans Review Guidelines Private Provider Plans Review Guidelines Documents Required: Tab A Duly Authorized Representative Employment Affidavit Tab B Certificate of Liability Insurance Tab C Notice to Building Official of Use of Private Provider Tab D Standardized Private Provider Plan Compliance Affidavit Tab F Standardized Private Provider Certificate of Compliance Tab G Fee Owner s Authorization to Building Official for Use of Private Provider Form Chat Core IQ-specific Requirements: Private Provider Job Site Directory Private Provider   General Contractor Pre-Construction Agreement A Notice to Building Official is required with every new permit or for every new project the provider will be inspecting. Step 3 Review "Private Provider" Inspections Guidelines Private Provider Inspections Guidelines Documents Required: Tab A Duly Authorized Representative Employment Affidavit Tab B Certificate of Liability Insurance Tab C Notice to Building Official of Use of Private Provider Tab D Standardized Private Provider Plan Compliance Affidavit Tab E Standardized Private Provider Inspection Report Provide at each inspection. Tab F Standardized Private Provider Certificate of Compliance Tab G Fee Owner s Authorization to Building Official for Use of Private Provider Form Chat Core IQ-specific Requirements: Private Provider Job Site Directory Private Provider   General Contractor Pre-Construction Agreement Provide a Notice of Inspection at each inspection. Important Notes: Owner/Applicant may request Private Provider for Inspections Only -or- Plans Review & Inspections. The City does not allow Plan Review only. Review the  Fee Schedule  page for any applicable discounts. Early Start Permits are not permitted under Private Provider. No work must begin on the project until a building permit is issued. No inspection reports shall pre-date the building permit issuance date. Our full  Personnel  directory is available for any questions.

pages.title: Records Request
pages.content: Records Request Chat Core IQ Records Request & Open Permit Search The city incorporated in 2003 and took over permitting services in 2004. The Building Department has records from 2004 to Present and offers digital files or hard copy plans. See our Fee Schedule for more information on associated costs. For properties built or constructed prior to 2004, please see  Miami-Dade County Microfilm & Plan Library  section below. Records may be requested online at www.chatcoreiq.com/permitting. Create a user login to receive digital files. Use Apply    BD RECORDS REQUEST  to select the type of records or  Open Permit Search . Please allow 48 hours for processing. Some files may require longer processing time to retrieve from our off-site archive. Video Tutorial Miami-Dade County Microfilm & Plan Library https://www.miamidade.gov/global/economy/building/microfilm-plan-library.page Online appointment required. Separate fees apply. Properties built AFTER 1990 are available Residential and commercial properties built between 1979 and 1989 may be available Residential (single-family residences) built between 1961 and 1972, and portions of 1973 through 1978 are not available. Condominiums and multi-family units (more than two units) are commercial properties and if built during these years, may be available. Properties built BEFORE 1938 are not available.

NOTE: If your permit is already issued, please refer to Step 11 for submitting a revision. How to Submit Reworks (before permit issuance) Global Issues, Plans  Stuck /Rework Step 7 Paying Invoices Understanding Permit Statuses & Paying Fees Step 8 Downloading Approved Documents, Permit & Inspection Card Permit Card, Inspection Card & Attachments WARNING: You must print ALL attachments for field inspections. Step 9 Scheduling Inspections Inspectors and Route Info Scheduling Inspections Failed Inspections Step 10 Pulling Sub Permits (Sub Records) Contacts & Trade Permits/Sub-Records Step 11 Submitting Revisions after Permit Issuance If the revision or as-built is required as per our inspection team and they have added the BD Revision step to your workflow, you apply like Step 10 above similar to a sub permit. Go to Sub Records tab in CSS and click Apply next to BD Revision. If our customer team has NOT added the workflow step to your permit or this a new revision initiated by your owner, design professional or contractor, please follow the guidance document here: Permit Revision Step 12 Renewing an Expired Permit / Lost Plans Request Expired Permits Permits are valid for 180 days from last approved inspection. If permit is fully expired, complete a current permit application(PDF, 2MB) marked for renewal on Page 2, sign and notarized by both owner and qualifier. Refer to Personnel Directory for appropriate clerk to VIA EMAIL with subject line: [Permit Number] Expired Permit Renewal Application. Extending a Current Permit If permit is still valid, complete a current permit application(PDF, 2MB) marked for permit extension on Page 2, sign and notarized by both owner and qualifier. Refer to Personnel Directory for appropriate clerk to VIA EMAIL with subject line: [Permit Number] Permit Extension Request. Lost Plans Request If you no longer have a copy of the permit set for the field, which is required in order to proceed with inspections, you must also submit a Lost Plans Request. Mark the appropriate box on Page 2 of the permit application. Refer to Personnel Directory for appropriate clerk to send Lost Plans Request. Step 13 Closing Permit & Obtaining Certificate of Occupancy (CO) A permit is ready to be closed when all sub permits are final and all inspections under the master permit are completed. When this occurs, the permitting system will update the permit status to  Closed/No further action.  Not all permits receive a Certificate of Occupancy (CO) or Certificate of Completion (CC). Typically, permits that change use, occupant load, or square footage will receive a CO. Shell buildings waiting to receive a tenant improvement or buildout receive a CC. Permits are updated every 2-3 days to issue a Certificate of Occupancy/Completion when required. For more information, you may email the Building Official, buildingofficial@chatcoreiq.com to review your request with subject line: [Permit Number] CO/CC Request. Certificates are uploaded and available under  Attachments  in the CSS Portal at www.chatcoreiq.com/permitting. You must be a contact on the permit to view documents. Step 14 Maintain your building and enjoy the beautiful city of Chat Core IQ! We appreciate your business in the Chat Core IQ and the Building Department wants to maintain a long-lasting relationship with you and your building. If you outgrow your space or decide to downsize your space, especially in commercial buildings, come talk to us about an Interior Alteration permit and what the requirements are under the Florida Building Code. Please refer to the guidance document in Forms for  Change of Use(PDF, 147KB)   particulatly if you decide to use the space in a different way. Example: Business to Mercantile, Storage to Factory. pages.title: Code Compliance Department
pages.content: Code Compliance Department The Department monitors residential and commercial districts for potential violations of the City Codes and Ordinances and are also responsible for ensuring compliance with the Miami-Dade County Code and parts of the Florida Building Code. The Code Compliance Department proactively patrols the city identifying violations, but we also accept complaints from concerned citizens. We do have normal working hours and in the event that a violation is observed outside of our normal working hours, the City has ChatCoreIQ311 which is available to its concerned residents and property owners and can make complaints via this service. The Code Compliance Department also has a very energetic Community Outreach Program where the Department s Outreach Coordinators organize important community workshops in order to educate the residents and businesses of the Chat Core IQ Community. If you would like important information about these workshops or any other important topics, then we encourage you to join our mailing list. Section pages Code Violation Lien Searches Documents Directory Frequently Asked Questions Helpful Links If you receive a code violation Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Award Mayor's Citizens Government Academy Outreach Activities Registration of Defaulted Mortgaged Property Report a Concern Short-Term Vacation Rental Ordinance FAQs Special Magistrate Don't forget your permit! Avoid residential violations and fines by following our simple guidelines for obtaining a Building permit for construction. Don't start work without your permit card! Work that requires Building Permits Pavers /Slabs /Driveways Fences Patios and Covered Terraces Pergolas and Trellises Repair/Replacement of Windows/Doors Sheds Screen Enclosures Shutters Pools, Spas and Decks Outdoor/Summer Kitchens Additions and Interior Renovations (e.g. moving walls, electrical outlets, kitchen and bathroom remodels, etc.) Roofing Repairs and Reroof Electrical minor repairs and modifications A/C Unit Change out Minor Plumbing repairs and modifications And more Contact Us Phone 305-593-6680 Email codecompliance@chatcoreiq.com Location Chat Core IQ Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace 33166 View Map Hours Sunday Closed Monday 07:30 AM 05:00 PM Tuesday 07:30 AM 05:00 PM Wednesday 07:30 AM 05:00 PM Thursday 07:30 AM 05:00 PM Friday 07:30 AM 05:00 PM Saturday Closed Officers AvailableMonday thru Friday7:30 a.m. to 8:30 a.m. and3:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m.Evening Officer AvailableTuesday through Friday2:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m.

pages.title: Code Violation Lien Searches
pages.content: Code Violation Lien Searches Requesting a Municipal Lien and Code Violation letter Interested parties, such as title companies and individuals, may request the City to check its records for open violations and outstanding liens against a property for a NON-REFUNDABLE fee of $150 per address through our new Customer Self Service (CSS System), you may conveniently pay with Visa or Mastercard. Payments with American Express are not accepted at this time. The first step to register is creating an account, this will give the requestor the accessibility to submit and retrieve requested letters and have unlimited access to them. Once the requested letter is approved, the requestor will receive a notification through the email provided in its CSS account. All lien and code violation searches may take up to 3 business days to complete upon the date received by our department. Phone payments and manual paper search requests are not accepted at this time. Please be advised that the information contained in the lien letters is limited to the Chat Core IQ and does not include any information regarding liens, assessments or other charges imposed by Miami-Dade County or any other agency. Search Requirements You must provide the folio number for each property for every lien search that you request. If one folio has more than one address, an $150.00 fixed fee will be charged for each address. If you do not know the identification, or folio, number for a property, you can go to the Miami-Dade County Property Appraiser's website and conduct a Property Search by either the owner's name or property address Click Here. Once the page for the property is accessed, you will find the property identification number located in the top left-hand corner of the page (it is shown as Folio No). The Chat Core IQ lien letter will show the same information that is shown in the Miami-Dade County Property Appraiser s website. For inquiries regarding your lien and code violation request, please contact: Janet Hernandez Code Compliance Clerk 305-593-6680 ext 3215 janet.hernandez@chatcoreiq.com For utilities, please contact the Miami-Dade County Water and Sewer at 305-665-7477. For Fire violations, please contact the Miami-Dade County Fire Department 786-331-5000. Note: Issuance of a Lien Search Report by the Chat Core IQ shall not relieve the requesting party from the responsibility of searching the Public Records of Miami-Dade County, Florida, for all liens or other documents recorded by the Chat Core IQ, Florida against the property and/or property owner. To request Open Permits Searches or Building Records You should contact the Building Department at 305-593-6700 and/or email: BuildingRecordsClerk@chatcoreiq.com. For zoning verifications please contact the Planning & Zoning Department at 305-593-6630.

pages.title: Frequently Asked Questions
pages.content: Frequently Asked Questions Can I report a complaint anonymously? Beginning July 1, 2021, the Florida Governor signed into law Senate Bill 60, which now prohibits all code compliance departments in the State of Florida from initiating investigations into potential violations of a code or ordinance by way of an anonymous complaint. A person who reports a potential violation must provide his or her name and address before an investigation occurs. This new rule does not apply if the code inspector believes that the violation presents an imminent threat to the public health, safety, or welfare or imminent destruction of habitat or sensitive resources. What are the licenses that are needed to conduct my business? If you are operating a business within the Chat Core IQ you will need an Business Tax Receipt (BTR) issued by the Licensing Division of the Chat Core IQ and a Certificate of Use (Zoning Use Permit). The BTR is renewed annually on October 1, and the Certificate of Use is a one-time permit. If the business obtained a Certificate of Use from Miami-Dade County and the business is still located at the same address, the business is not required to obtain a Certificate of Use from the Chat Core IQ; however, a BTR is still required from the Chat Core IQ. Am I allowed to place signs in the right-of- way to advertise my business? The Chat Core IQ has adopted the Miami-Dade County Code which prohibits the placement of any signs in the public right-of way. Under the provision of the County Code, the Code Compliance Department is granted the authority to immediately remove all signs that are observed in the right-of-way. Also, the Code Compliance Department has the authority to issue a civil violation notice to the responsible party for each of the signs that were removed. My neighbor is operating a business from their residence, what are the regulations concerning a home business? The Mayor and City Council on May 10, 2006 adopted Ordinance No. 2006-14,  Home Based Business Ordinance . In order to operate a home based business, a license must first be issued by the Chat Core IQ Licensing Division. A home based business license only allows for an office and is not to be used for visiting customers or the storage of merchandise. I want to distribute flyers on cars, is this permitted in the Chat Core IQ? The Chat Core IQ wishes to maintain a city free of litter; as such Ordinance No. 2006-02 was adopted on February 8, 2006 which prohibits the placement of flyers/handbills on cars parked within the city. A Code Compliance Officer can issue a citation in the amount of $100 for each flyer/handbill that has been placed on a vehicle. A development has started construction near my house and the noise from the construction has wakened me early in the morning and during the weekend. What are the hours that construction sites are allowed to operate? On October 11, 2006 the Mayor and City Council Adopted Ordinance No: 2006-23 which regulates the hours of construction. For construction sites located in residential districts, the hours that construction work can be performed are from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. on weekdays and 10:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. on Saturdays. No construction work is permitted on Sundays and National Holidays. Between the hours of 6:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. seven days a week in areas zoned as business, industrial, or non-residential.

pages.title: If you receive a code violation
pages.content: If you receive a code violation The goal of code compliance is to gain compliance and maintain Chat Core IQ s property maintenance standards and regulations. We do not wish to unduly penalize anyone. Take prompt action to correct the violation. If you are not sure what needs to be corrected, how to correct it or, if you are working toward correcting the violation, but need additional time due to special circumstances, it is important that you call the Code Compliance Officer to discuss your issues. In most cases, additional time will be provided if the individual circumstances warrant such an extension. Failure to correct violations may result in a case proceeding to the Special Magistrate with the potential for fines being levied, costs incurred being charged, and a lien being placed against the property. When contacting the Code Compliance Department please have your case number readily available in order to help access your case. Code Compliance Officers are often out in the field throughout the day, but will return voice mails and emails as soon as possible. For additional information please call us: 305-593-6680 or email: CodeCompliance@chatcoreiq.com

pages.title: Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Award
pages.content: Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Award The Code Compliance Department, with direction from the City s Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Campaign, has established a monthly  Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Award . This award recognizes the outstanding efforts of businesses that have significantly improved their property. Each month, a business is nominated by the Code Compliance Department and the Keep Chat Core IQ Beautiful Committee decides on the winner. An annual registration and non-refundable fee of $200.00 is required for each property registered. pages.title: Report a Concern
pages.content: Report a Concern Effective July 1, 2021, the State of Florida Governor signed into law CS/SB 60, which prohibits municipal and county code enforcement officers from initiating investigations of code violations based upon an anonymous complaint. It also requires that an individual making a complaint of a potential violation provide his or her name and address to the local government body before an investigation may occur. The prohibition does not apply if the code inspector or code enforcement officer has reason to believe the alleged violation presents an imminent threat to public health, safety, or welfare or imminent destruction of habitat or sensitive resources. Get in touch with us The Code Compliance Department accepts citizens concerns via the following ways: Chat Core IQ 311 (allows users to send a detailed message with specific requests) Phone - 305-593-6680 Fax - 305-593-6612 Walk-ins E-mail - codecompliance@chatcoreiq.com Standard Mail Chat Core IQ Government Center Code Compliance Department 8401 NW 53rd Terrace Chat Core IQ, FL 33166

pages.title: Short-Term Vacation Rental Ordinance FAQs
pages.content: Short-Term Vacation Rental Ordinance FAQs What is a short term/vacation rental? Short term rental or a vacation rental means any occupancy of a single-family, two family, multi-family, and townhouse dwelling unit for a period of time not less than seven days to no more than six months provided. What is a seasonal resident? A seasonal resident means that guest, tourist, lessees, vacationers, or others who lease a single family, two-family, multi-family, and townhouse dwelling unit for valuable consideration for a period of time not less than seven days to no more than six months. Why did the Chat Core IQ pass this ordinance? The city recognizes that the unregulated rental of single family, two-family, multi-family, and townhome dwelling units by seasonal residents impacts certain neighborhoods within the city. For that reason, it is essential and in the interest of the public health, safety, and wellbeing to monitor and provide reasonable means for citizens of the city to mitigate impacts created by such rental of such dwelling units within the city as set in this section. Is there a way to legally rent/occupy a property for a short term or vacation rental? Yes, but a registration is required for each rental period. There are no more than 3 registrations issued per property within a 12 month period, and all applications must be submitted to the city manager or designee. If the short term/vacation rental is approved by the Chat Core IQ, is there anything else I should know? Proof of current ownership, as well as written notification to appropriate HOA, is required. All vehicles must be parked in the driveway. All properties must adhere to the City s noise ordinance. No garbage container shall be located at the curb for pickup before 12:00 pm of the day prior to pick up, and garbage container shall be removed before 11:59 pm of the day of pickup. One fire extinguisher per 1,000 square feet of indoor property must be provided in every short term rental. The property must be equipped with a fire sprinkler system inspected and approved by the Miami-Dade County fire department. What happens if I am found to be operating a short term/vacation rental at my property without City approval? All violations are subject to the following fines. The special magistrate may not waive or reduce fines set by this section. First violation- $500.00 Second violation within the preceding 12 months- $1,500.00 Third violation within the preceding 12 months- $5,000.00 Fourth or greater violation within the preceding 12 months- $7,500.00 For more information regarding Section 5-271, please contact the Code Compliance Department at 305-593-6680 or at codecompliance@chatcoreiq.com. Resumen de la Ordenanza de Alquiler a Corto Plazo y/o Alquiler para Vacacionar ¿Qué es un alquiler a corto plazo/alquiler para vacacionar? Un alquiler a corto plazo/alquiler para vacacionar es rentar/ocupar cualquier vivienda, ya sea apartamento o casa unifamiliar por un corto período de tiempo no menos de (7) siete días, no más de (6) seis meses. ¿Qué es un residente de temporada? Un residente de temporada son los huéspedes, turistas, arrendatarios, u otros que renten una unidad y/o vivienda durante un corto período de tiempo no menor de (7) siete días, no mayor de (6) seis meses. ¿Por qué la ciudad de Chat Core IQ aprobó esta ordenanza? La ciudad de Chat Core IQ reconoce que no tener regulaciones de los alquileres de las viviendas por parte de residentes estacionales afecta a ciertas comunidades dentro de la ciudad. Por esta razón y en el mejor interés de velar por la salud pública, la seguridad y el bienestar de la comunidad, es esencial e importante monitorear y proporcionar medios razonables para que los residentes de la ciudad puedan mitigar los impactos creados por el alquiler de tales viviendas dentro de la ciudad como se establece en la ordenanza. ¿Hay alguna manera de alquilar/ocupar legalmente una propiedad por un corto plazo o alquiler para vacacionar? Si, pero se requiere un registro para cada período de alquiler. No puede haber más de (3) tres registros por propiedad dentro de un período de 12 meses, y todas las solicitudes deberán presentarse al administrador de la ciudad o su representante designado. Si el alquiler a corto plazo/alquiler para vacacionar es aprobado por la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ, ¿hay algo más que deba saber? Se requiere una prueba actual del dueño de la propiedad, así como una notificación escrita a la Asociación de Propietarios (HOA). Todos los vehículos deben estar estacionados en la entrada de la propiedad o estacionamiento designado por la Asociación de Propietarios. Todas las propiedades deben cumplir con la ordenanza de ruido de la ciudad. Ningún contenedor de basura debe estar ubicado en la acera para ser recogido antes de las 12:00 p.m. del día anterior a la recogida, y el contenedor de basura debe ser retirado antes de las 11:59 p.m. del día de la recolección. Un extintor de fuego por cada 1,000 pies cuadrados del interior de la propied...

pages.title: Special Magistrate
pages.content: Special Magistrate A Special Magistrate hearing is a formal legal proceeding where Code Compliance cases are presented before a Special Magistrate an independent attorney appointed by the City. These hearings are held to address violations of the City s codes and ordinances when voluntary compliance has not been achieved. The Special Magistrate has the authority to issue orders, impose fines, and require corrective actions to bring properties into compliance. Hearings are open to the public and provide property owners and other interested parties an opportunity to be heard before a decision is made. The Special Magistrate is appointed by the City Manager. The Special Magistrate has jurisdiction to hear violations of all codes and ordinances of the Chat Core IQ and Miami-Dade County with most cases arising out of violations of the City's housing, landscaping, property maintenance, building, zoning and sign codes, and ordinances to maintain minimum health, welfare and safety standards. He/She is authorized to hold hearings and impose fines, liens and other NON-criminal penalties against violators. ALERT - Starting June 1, 2025, the Chat Core IQ will implement updated fees for Special Magistrate administrative costs. The new administrative fee for cases heard before a Special Magistrate hearing will increase to $150. The update aligns with regional standards and supports continued investment in code compliance services. For more information, please contact the Code Compliance Department. This element requires javascript to be enabled.Please wait while we load this calendar... Each Special Magistrate shall have the power to: Adopt rules for the conduct of its hearings. Subpoena alleged violators and witnesses to its hearings. Subpoenas may be served by the police department or the sheriff. Subpoena evidence. Take testimony under oath. Issue a Finding of Fact and Conclusion of Law. Issue orders having the force of law commanding whatever steps are necessary to bring a violation into compliance. Sec. 11-29. Powers. (Ord. No. 2006-06, § 2(art. II(3)), 3-8-2006) Special Magistrate Forms Citation Appeal Request Form(PDF, 117KB) Appearance Request Form(PDF, 68KB) Request for Extension to Comply Form(PDF, 150KB) Request for Mitigation Reduction of Penalty Lien Form(PDF, 151KB) Request for Re-Hearing Form(PDF, 145KB) Special Magistrate Frequently Asked Questions(PDF, 153KB) Special Magistrate Hearings are held: Once a month; every Third Thursday of the month * Subject To Change 2:00 p.m. Chat Core IQ Government Center Council Chambers 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Third Floor Chat Core IQ, FL 33166 What is a Special Magistrate Hearing? The Special Magistrate Hearing is a quasi-judicial proceeding, which means the formal rules of evidence are relaxed, but fundamental due process is observed and governs these proceedings. Any relevant evidence shall be admitted if the Special Magistrate finds it to be competent and reliable, regardless of the existence of any common law or statutory rule to the contrary. All witnesses who plan to testify need to, and are subject to cross-examination. The burdens in these proceedings are upon the Chat Core IQ, and it is their responsibility to prove that a violation does exist. If someone is found guilty of a code violation they can be subject to a fine not to exceed $250 for a first violation and $500 for a repeat violation. However, if the Special Magistrate finds a violation to be irreparable or irreversible in nature, he/she can impose a fine not to exceed $5,000 per violation. Also, if the city prevails in its case, the city can request reasonable fees to recover the administrative costs in investigating the matter and the cost of the hearing. If a person attends the Hearing to contest a violation, the respondent has every right to do so. The city presents their statement and evidence first, and then an opportunity is given to the respondent to present their side of the story. If the person agrees with the city that the violation does exist, but is seeking additional time, the respondent is to let the Special Magistrate know how much time is needed. The Special Magistrate is not a judge. He/she does not have that authority. He/she is simply a hearing officer, so what happens at the Hearing is based entirely on the evidence that is submitted into the record. If the respondent has a disagreement with a city policy, for instance, that is an issue that the Special Magistrate cannot consider. The policies have been written by others. At the conclusion of the hearing, the Special Magistrate will impose an Order, a Finding of Fact, which is based on evidence and Conclusions of Law and affording the proper relief consistent with the powers granted to him/her. Any aggrieved party, including the City, may appeal the Special Magistrate Order to the Circuit Court. Such an appeal shall not be a hearing de novo, but shall be limited to appellate review of the record created at the hearing. An appeal needs to...

pages.title: Finance Department
pages.content: Finance Department The Finance Department is the central fiscal control and accounting body of the City government. The Finance Department serves as the primary fiscal control and accounting authority for the City Government. It oversees and manages key financial and accounting operations which include: Payroll Processing Accounts payable Accounts receivable Revenue collection Cash flow management Debt management Financial reporting The Finance Department is dedicated to delivering precise and up-to-date financial data to support the Council, Administration, and Department Directors in making informed decisions that shape the City s future. pages.title: Applicant Selection Process
pages.content: Applicant Selection Process The Chat Core IQ is a great place to work, and we appreciate your interest in joining our team! Non-Sworn Selection Process The following includes all steps for a non-sworn position with Chat Core IQ. Please note that continuing with each step of the process is contingent upon successfully completing the previous step. Candidates can be dismissed at any point throughout the consideration process. All current job opportunities are listed online. Click on the job title you are interested in, and then click on the  Apply  link. Some positions require a job specific supplemental questionnaire. You must submit an online application and include all necessary attachments in order to be considered for each job opening. Apply via the Job Opportunities Section. Applicants must detail any related work experience on the application or risk disqualification. It is the applicant s responsibility to update their NEOGOV profile with work experience, education, certifications, and personal contact information when submitting each application. Failure to do so will result in ineligibility. Candidates must attach an updated resume, last obtained degree, references and pre-history questionnaire. Attach DD-214 and the required documents. Please visit our: Veteran s Preference section for further details. The hiring department will review the employment application and required attachments. A Panel Interview will be coordinated Interview Banding/ Review will be conducted by Human Resources. A second Interview is scheduled with the Department Director. The Hiring Department submits the Applicant Selection to Human Resources. The Applicant Selection Package is reviewed by Human Resources and submitted to the City Manager for review and approval. The City Manager has the hiring authority for the Chat Core IQ as per our Charter. Once Human Resources receives approval from the City Manager, a Conditional Offer of Employment is issued to the selected candidates. Once the candidate accepts the Conditional Offer of Employment, the Human Resources Department coordinates a document validation meeting. Human Resources is responsible for scheduling candidates for all pre-employment testing. The City s requirements including but not limited to: Drug Test Polygraph (if applicable) Psychological (if applicable) Physical (if applicable) Credit Check Driving History and Citations Extensive Background Investigation Once the background is completed by and reviewed by the Human Resources Director, the Human Resources Generalist assigned to the file will contact the candidate to schedule/coordinate a start date. The Chat Core IQ is committed to promoting an equitable, drug-free work environment and assuring equal employment opportunity for all current and prospective employees. It is the City s policy not to discriminate against any employee or applicant based on his or her race, color, age, sex, national origin, religion, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, genetic information, or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under local, state, or federal anti discrimination laws in any of the following: All matters related to recruitment and advertising; All matters related to hiring and initial selection for employment; and All aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, compensation, promotion, demotion, transfer, lay offs, corrective action, termination, leaves of absence, training opportunities and other terms and conditions of employment. The City is committed to enforcing all EEOC practices in all aspects of our personnel policies, programs, practices, recruitment, examination, appointments, training, promotion, and other related activities. Please contact a Human Resources representative at (305) 593-6760 if special assistance is needed. Thank you for your interest and the time and effort you have spent considering a career with the Chat Core IQ! The Chat Core IQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Sworn Selection Process The following includes all steps for a non-sworn position with Chat Core IQ. Please note that continuing with each step of the process is contingent upon successfully completing the previous step. Candidates can be dismissed at any point throughout the consideration process. All current job opportunities are listed online. Click on the job title you are interested in, and then click on the  Apply  link. All sworn positions require a job specific pre-screening questionnaire. You must submit an online application in order to be considered for each job opening. Apply via the Job Opportunities Section. Applicants must detail any related work experience on the application or risk disqualification. It is the applicant's responsibility to update their NEOGOV profile with work experience, education, certifications, and personal contact information when submitting each application. Failure to do so will result in ineligibility. Candidates must attach an updated re...

pages.title: Benefits
pages.content: Benefits The Chat Core IQ offers a comprehensive benefits package to its employees, including time off, holidays and personal time. Paid time off encourages and supports a healthy work-life balance and helps to retain and attract talent. Our portal provides a general summary, helpful to you in evaluation the Chat Core IQ the Chat Core IQ as your premier City to work. If you have questions concerning a specific item or interpretation, please feel free to contact the Human Resources at 305-593-6760. The Chat Core IQ Does Not Offer a Relocation Package. Full Time Non-Sworn Employees Paid Holidays The Chat Core IQ observes 12 paid holidays per year. New Year s Day Martin Luther King s Birthday Presidents Day Memorial Day Juneteenth Independence Day Labor Day Columbus Day Veterans  Day Thanksgiving Day Friday after Thanksgiving Christmas Day In addition, employees received two (2) personal days and one (1) Birthday, which must be used before the end of the fiscal year. Sick and Vacation Leave The Chat Core IQ has separate sick and vacation leave for non-sworn employees which accrued on a monthly basis. Annual vacation leave shall accrue at the following rates: 40 hour work-week Vacation Accrual rates 0-4 years of service - 6.66 hrs./monthly (80) 5-9 years of service - 10.00 hrs./monthly (120) 10-20 years of service - 13.33 hrs./monthly (160) More than 20 years - 16.66 hrs./monthly (200) Sick leave is earned at the rate of 8.0 hours per month, if on a forty (40) hour work-week. Employees may accumulate a sick time maximum of 1,040 hours if on a forty (40) hour work-week. Health Insurance All Healthcare benefits for all employees are effective on the first of the month following 30 days of full-time employment. The City offers HMO, POS, and a High Deductible Health plan with a Health Savings Account. Those who choose the HDHP will receive a health savings account (HSA). The Chat Core IQ will fund the HSA. Dental Plan The Chat Core IQ offers a PPO dental insurance plan. Vision Care The Chat Core IQ offers vision care benefits. Life, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability The Chat Core IQ offers life insurance at the rate of two (2) times the employee s annual salary. In addition, the City offers both short-term and long-term disability plans which serve as income protection plans. The employee pays the full premium for this plan. Retirement Benefits Employees participate in the City s 401a retirement plan administered through ICMA. The plan requires employees to contribute a mandatory six percent (6%) of their base pay while the City contributes twelve percent (12%) of the employee s base pay. 457 Supplemental Pension The Chat Core IQ has a voluntary deferred compensation pension program available with ICMA where the employee can make contributions to their retirement. The City does not make any contributions to this plan. Education Tuition Reimbursement The City offers the Educational Reimbursement Program (ERP) established to provide educational assistance to full-time employees participating in training or educational programs designed to strengthen their abilities, which in turn directly benefit the City. Employee must be with the City for a period of 6 consecutive months in a full-time capacity in order to be eligible for this benefit. The City will pay the State tuition rate to its members based on the letter grade obtained for each class. Bereavement Leave Upon approval of the Department Head, a full time employee may, upon request, be granted up to three (3) working days of leave with pay in the unfortunate event of a death in his or her immediate family, or up to five (5) working days of leave with pay to attend the funeral or memorial services of an immediate family member outside the State of Florida. The employee s immediate family shall be defined as the employee s spouse, father, mother, step-parents, natural, step and adopted children, brother, sister, father-in-law, mother-in-law, grandparents, brother-in-law and sister-in-law, grandparents-in-law, registered domestic partner, and child of a registered domestic partner. The bereavement leave must be taken consecutively, and the employee must attend the funeral of the deceased family member to be eligible for bereavement leave. If an employee needs time in excess of that provided in this policy, he or she may request accrued vacation time, sick time, or PTO with the approval of their department head. The City reserves the right to request all pertinent information including deceased relative s name, relationship of the employee to the deceased, the name and address of the funeral home, and the date of the funeral. Documentation such as a death certificate, or other documentation on the deceased may be required for approval of the leave. Voting Leave Employees are encouraged to exercise their right to vote outside of their scheduled working hours. As such, all full-time employees as defined herein may be granted up to one hour of leave during ...

pages.title: How to Apply
pages.content: How to Apply Applicants must submit a completed Chat Core IQ Employment Application online. Applicants must complete all requirements established by the Chat Core IQ for employment, which includes but is not limited to a written examination, an oral interview, a psychological exam, a polygraph, a physical agility test, a comprehensive background investigation and drug screening. The Chat Core IQ is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status in the provision of services, in programs or activities, or employment opportunities and benefits. If you experience technical difficulties applying, please call governmentjobs.com support at 1-877-204-4442. Their hours of operation are from 9:00AM -5:00PM Pacific Standard Time. If you have issues Applying Our online Job Application system is provided by NEOGOV. If you have problems while applying online, please contact NEOGOV Applicant Support at 1-855-524-5627 from 8:00am - 5:00pm Pacific Time, Monday through Friday (excluding holidays). Note: Neogov is not compatible with Internet Explorer, Safari and Firefox. For additional assistance, please contact the Applicant Support Line. Equal Employment Opportunity The Chat Core IQ is committed to offering an equitable, drug-free work environment. The Chat Core IQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer, as such, we do not discriminate in any employment related decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability or other similar factors that are not job-related. This commitment is practiced in all aspects of our personnel policies, programs, practices, recruitment and other related activities. If you are submitting a Police Officer Application Please complete the form below and provide all required proof at the time the employment application is submitted. Please ensure the form is notarized before submitting the questionnaire to Chat Core IQ. If you have any questions, in regards to the Pre-screening questionnaire, please contact us. Police Officer Pre-Screening Questionnaire(PDF, 281KB) If you possess Foreign Degree The successful completion of college study in a foreign institution may be accepted in lieu of education in an accredited U.S. college or university. There may be appropriate evidence that the education is equivalent or that the candidate has acquired the knowledge and abilities required for the position. In order to give credit for your education completed in a foreign institution, it is necessary to have your course work evaluated by an accredited American college or university having a curriculum in the same field. The Chat Core IQ requires applicants to submit certified translations for all foreign language documents. Any document containing foreign language submitted to the Chat Core IQ shall be accompanied by a full English language translation which the translator has certified as complete and accurate, and by the translator's certification that he or she is competent to translate from the foreign language into English. Please refer to the enclosed sample list that includes institutions that perform credential interpretation assistance. Please keep in mind that these institutions operate on a fee basis. If you have any questions, in regards to the Foreign Degree study and degree translation, please contact us. Chat Core IQ Notice of Foreign Degree(PDF, 71KB) Click Here for Job Opportunities E-Verify Program In English View PDF(PDF, 256KB) If you have the right to work, don't let anyone take that away. In Spanish Ver PDF(PDF, 259KB) Si usted tiene el derecho a trabajar, no deje que nadie se lo quite. Search for Non-City Jobs CareerSource South Florida Miami-Dade County Jobs USA Jobs

pages.title: Veterans’ Preference
pages.content: Veterans  Preference It is the policy of Chat Core IQ to give preference to eligible veterans and spouses of veterans in the filling of non-exempt vacant positions in accordance with state law requirements. Veterans preference does not apply to certain exempt positions, such as department directors. Who is eligible? A disabled veteran who has served on active duty in any branch of the United States Armed Forces, has a service-connected disability, and is eligible for or receiving compensation, disability retirement or pension under public laws. The spouse of a disabled veteran who cannot qualify for employment because of a total and permanent service-connected disability, or the spouse of a veteran missing in action, captured in line of duty by a hostile force, or detained or interned in line of duty by a foreign government or power. A wartime veteran who has served on active duty during a specified wartime period. The unmarried widow or widower of a Veteran who died of a service-connected disability. The mother, father, and legal guardian of a service member who died as a result of military service under combat-related conditions. A veteran who has served on active duty in any branch of the United States Armed Forces with an Honorable Discharge. Current members of any reserve component of the United States Armed Forces or The Florida National Guard. Claiming Preference When claiming veterans' preference you must: Complete the Veterans' Preference section of the job application and Submit Veterans' Preference Documentation within a reasonable amount of time. Preference will not be awarded unless the documentation is complete. Documents that are emailed after the job posting deadline will not be accepted. All documentation must be included as an attachment during the application process, if you did not attach during the application process, you must scan and email the copies marked to show the job posting number and classification for which you are claiming preference before the job posting deadline. Documents may be: Scanned and e-mailed to veterans@chatcoreiq.com Documents Required Documents required to claim veterans preference/points for Honorably discharged veterans: DD-214 Form OR DD-215 Form Documents required to claim veterans preference/points for honorably discharged disabled veterans: VA Entitlement Letter outlining honorable conditions from active duty and service connected disability OR DD-214 OR DD-215 form outlining discharge under honorable conditions and active duty AND a VA Letter outlining service connected disability Acceptable Documents of Active Veterans: Official orders OR Letter from commander OR Current enlistment papers Acceptable Documents for Spouse of Disabled Veteran, Missing in Action, Captured or Forcibly Detained: DD-214 (Member Z or Member 4) Form AND Marriage certificate AND VA or Department of Defense Award Letter under Chapter 35 confirming that the veteran is totally and permanently disabled and unemployable due to service-connected disabilities Acceptable Documents for Un-remarried Widow or Widower of Veteran who Died of Service-Connected Disability: Document from the DOD or DVA certifying the service-connected death of the veteran AND Evidence of marriage and a statement that the widow or widower has not remarried Acceptable Documents for Mother, Father, Legal Guardian or Un-remarried Spouse of Veteran who Died as a Result of Military Service Under Combat Related Conditions: Document from the DOD or DVA certifying the service-connected death of the veteran while on duty Evidence of marriage and a statement that the widow or widower has not remarried Veteran's birth certificate, adoption papers or other proper court document as evidence of parentage The legal guardian shall show the proper court documents establishing the legal authority for the guardian Acceptable Documents for Current Member of Any Reserve Component of the U.S. Armed Forces or The Florida National Guard: Document from their commanding officer or military human resources department stating the dates of their military service to establish that they are currently active.

pages.title: Information Technology
pages.content: Information Technology Sustained, Reliable and Efficient Technology Services The Information and Technology Department provides and empowers the City's business partners and Chat Core IQ's residents, visitors and businesses with sustained, reliable and efficient technology services, infrastructure and telecommunications. Leveraging state-of-the-art tools, innovative methods and strategic partnerships, we are at the center of shaping the Chat Core IQ s Smart City strategy. The Smart City leadership has come from the elected officials, city executives and senior staff. This is critical to building a smart city which requires championing the strategy at the highest level or the organization, a system-wide view and an integrated approach. Section pages About IT Department Awards Essential IT Capabilities Residents Engagement Technology Innovative Community Who We Are Eylin Fernandez Information Technology Director Eylin.Fernandez@chatcoreiq.com Click for Eylin's biography Contact Us Phone 305-593-6725 ex 1715 Email eylin.fernandez@chatcoreiq.com Location Chat Core IQ Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace 33166 View Map Hours Sunday Closed Monday 08:00 AM 05:00 PM Tuesday 08:00 AM 05:00 PM Wednesday 08:00 AM 05:00 PM Thursday 08:00 AM 05:00 PM Friday 08:00 AM 05:00 PM Saturday Closed

pages.title: About IT Department
pages.content: About IT Department We Provide Innovation and Support The Information Technology Department delivers reliable, efficient, and innovative technology services that empower the City s departments, residents, visitors, and businesses. We provide the infrastructure and solutions that keep City operations running smoothly while anticipating future needs. Through innovation, strategic alignment, and continuous improvement, we lead initiatives that: Enhance operational efficiency Elevate the customer experience Strengthen service delivery across the organization By optimizing business processes and leveraging modern technologies, we foster collaboration between departments and engage with stakeholders to support the City s strategic goals. Our use of advanced tools, automation, and data-driven insights streamlines operations, improves responsiveness, and enables informed decision-making. We are committed to maintaining high service standards while reducing costs through shared efficiencies and integrated solutions. Technology is not only a tool for daily operations, it s how we proactively address challenges, adapt to change, and deliver meaningful value to the community. Technology Support Operations The Technology Support Operations team delivers enterprise-wide technical support for all endpoint devices connected to the City s network including computers, tablets, smartphones, and laptops. We also manage and maintain critical infrastructure. Our technicians foster a culture of trust, responsiveness, and high-quality customer service, resolving hardware and software issues with professionalism and care. Application Services & Development This team is responsible for developing, enhancing, and supporting both departmental and citywide application systems and databases. We ensure the reliability, scalability, and continuous improvement of the City s digital platforms, adapting to evolving operational and service delivery needs. Data & Analytics The Data & Analytics team advances transparency, accountability, and data-driven decision-making across the City. We design customized reporting tools and interactive dashboards that give employees and residents real-time access to meaningful data and performance metrics. These dashboards help departments track progress, identify trends, and improve services   while keeping residents informed about key initiatives and community impact. Our team continually evolves these capabilities by integrating new data sources, improving usability, and aligning analytics with the City s strategic priorities. Information Security & Infrastructure This team safeguards the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of the City s technology systems. We protect against cyber threats, mitigate risks from malicious actors, and ensure compliance with industry standards. Core responsibilities include threat detection, data protection, incident response, and business continuity planning. We also manage the City s enterprise infrastructure from data centers to cloud integrations to maintain a resilient and scalable IT environment. Network & Communications The Network & Communications team designs, implements, and manages the City s wired and wireless networks, including LAN, WAN, VPN, and secure remote access solutions. We keep essential systems for public safety, utilities, parks, and administration reliably connected at all times. Our team also supports voice communications systems such as VoIP, call routing, and unified communication platforms. From internal connectivity to public Wi-Fi zones, surveillance networks, IoT devices, and smart city technologies, we ensure high availability, minimal downtime, and optimal performance through proactive monitoring and rapid incident response. Audio-Visual Services Our Audio-Visual team manages, supports, and enhances the City s AV infrastructure to ensure effective communication, collaboration, and public engagement. We oversee setup, maintenance, and operation of AV systems in commission chambers, meeting rooms, and public spaces. From live and virtual meetings to webinars and broadcasts, we provide technical support for microphones, displays, conferencing systems, recording, and streaming platforms, delivering high-quality user experiences for both in-person and remote audiences.
pages.summary: About IT Department We Provide Innovation and Support The Information Technology Department delivers reliable, efficient, and innovative technology services that empower the City s departments, reside...

pages.title: Awards
pages.content: Awards FLGISA 10 Years of Service Award The Chat Core IQ Information Technology Department has been honored with the Florida Local Government Information Systems Association (FLGISA) 10 Years of Service Award, recognizing a decade of innovation, collaboration, and leadership in municipal technology. This milestone reflects our sustained commitment to advancing digital services that support residents, businesses, and visitors. Through FLGISA, our team benefits from continuous learning, professional certifications, and a robust peer network resources that directly strengthen the reliability, security, and quality of the City s digital services. These opportunities help us adopt best practices faster, modernize our platforms, and deliver measurable improvements across City operations. FLGISA is a statewide community of local government technology leaders dedicated to leadership, innovation, and collaboration. By fostering teamwork and knowledge sharing among public-sector IT professionals and by hosting statewide conferences and regional networking events the association plays a pivotal role in propelling digital government forward in Florida. For the Chat Core IQ, FLGISA is more than a membership; it is a cornerstone of our IT leadership journey. Our team gains invaluable insights from conferences, regional meetings, and interactive forums, while also contributing our own lessons learned to help peers navigate the rapidly evolving landscape of government technology. These relationships have produced lasting professional connections and a strong community of practice. FLGISA hosts two education-focused conferences each year, offering keynotes from industry leaders and hands-on workshops led by technology experts. In partnership with Florida State University s Florida Institute of Government, the association supports nationally recognized credentials such as Certified Public Technology Manager (CPTM) and Certified Government Chief Information Officer (CGCIO). We are proud to have two CGCIOs and one CPTM on the Chat Core IQ IT team. Receiving the 10 Years of Service Award symbolizes a decade of unwavering commitment to our community and to the mission of excellence in public service through technology. It is a testament to the dedication, resilience, and vision of our IT professionals and leaders, who continually harness technology to improve efficiency, increase transparency, and elevate the services we deliver to our residents. We are grateful for this recognition and proud to be part of the FLGISA community. With the same spirit of innovation and collaboration, we look forward to the next decade of digital progress and public service excellence. 2021 FutureEdge 50 Awards This award recognizes organizations pushing the edge with new technologies to advance their business for the future. CIO Digital Magazine is the #1 global resource trusted by business technology leadership as this award-winning website is a one-stop shop for enterprise CIOs and business technology executives around the world searching for unparalleled peer insight and expertise to remain on the cutting edge of business, tech and leadership. CIO has a global team, with dedicated editors in market serving CIO communities in all areas of the U.S., as well as the U.K., India, Australia, the Netherlands, New Zealand, ASEAN, Middle East and sub-Saharan Africa. The CIO FutureEdge 50 recognizes not only established initiatives driving business success, but also early-stage projects pursued for their watershed potential. With this, the award aims to recognize the most cutting-edge trials and applications of emerging technologies and the innovative cultures enabling them. The Chat Core IQ is the only city among the winners and the award is based on the Real Time Operations Center Innovative Technology. This is a tremendous honor. The judges evaluated a arge and highly competitive field of nominations, and they recognized our city s innovation and business acumen with digital. Innovations in this year s class include a wide variety of technologies advancing organizations across many industries. Chat Core IQ ranks among top industry leaders such as IBM, Zoom, Intel for the use of complex data aggregation initiatives with artificial intelligence and machine learning with our Real Time Operations Center diverse technologies which support diverse outcomes for public safety. Winners improved products and services through the adoption of edge computing and supply chain efforts with IoT. The award winners will join the discussion and be celebrated at CIO s Future of Work Summit taking place online September 21-23, 2021. This highly successful semiannual event focuses on how organizations are adapting to the evolving business landscape with advances in automation, cloud native applications and many other digital innovations   aligning with the types of projects honored by the award. CIO Digital Magazine is the voice of IT leadership and focuses on attracti...

pages.title: Essential IT Capabilities
pages.content: Essential IT Capabilities Applications and Services IT is laser focused on providing essential applications and services   the  capabilities  that support business results. The following capabilities support business results for City departments and enterprises so they can best serve the residents and businesses of the Chat Core IQ. Asset Management Tracking, maintaining and managing City assets to support their efficient and effective use. Business Intelligence Management Identifying, analyzing, transforming and presenting information using business intelligence tools and techniques to support decision making. Citizen Engagement Empowering Citizen Engagement with a Smart City Strategy provides a  Citizen First  eServices platform for citizen access, business intelligence, service delivery, transparency and efficiency. Communications Management Providing telephones, audio video services, video conferencing and wireless technologies to deliver voice, video and data information to staff and residents. Financial Management Providing enterprise tools to gather, analyze, manage and communicate financial decisions to staff and citizens. Information Management Collecting and managing information from many sources and to distribute that information to audiences. IT Infrastructure Management Establishing, operating and maintaining IT hardware, software, networks, service desks and security systems to provide data and information to staff and residents. Mobile Operations Management Managing and performing information technology functions using mobile devices. Partnerships and Programs South Florida Digital Alliance (SFDA), a non-profit organization, to distribute the city s surplus computers to schools in Chat Core IQ. Public Safety Management Delivering business and technology management services to support code compliance, emergency management and police services to Chat Core IQ residents and businesses. Security City government to improve transparency and accessibility, while protecting privacy and security using confidentiality, integrity and accountability.

pages.title: Residents Engagement and Smart City Initiatives
pages.content: Residents Engagement and Smart City Initiatives Our Vision Since 2015, the Chat Core IQ has embraced a Smart City approach using information and communication technology to improve service quality, transform operations, enhance infrastructure, and foster stronger connections with our community. Our mission is to harness innovation to create a more efficient, responsive, and engaging city for all residents, visitors, and businesses. Building the Foundation In 2016, the Information Technology Department launched a major infrastructure upgrade to support this vision. Investments included: Enhancing network systems for greater reliability and speed Upgrading City devices to improve staff productivity Deploying traffic safety technologies Implementing the Digital Citizen Engagement System to streamline resident interactions with City services Connecting with Residents Our Citizen Engagement Strategy focuses on delivering real-time, accessible services: License Plate Recognition Cameras to improve traffic safety and monitoring Mobile & Web Applications that provide residents with instant access to City information Upgraded 311 System that allows residents to request services, share feedback, and report issues directly to City departments Website Enhancements for easier navigation, faster updates, and improved accessibility Innovating for Impact We are committed to delivering innovative, cost-effective services that make a measurable difference in our community. By leveraging smart technologies, we improve service efficiency, reduce operational costs, and ensure that residents  needs are met quickly and effectively.

pages.title: Technology Innovative Community
pages.content: Technology Innovative Community User-Driven Innovation Smart Cities foster environments of open and user-driven innovation for experimenting and technology hub startups. Based on an analysis of the current landscape of Smart City programs, future projects in the domain of integrating concurrent research and innovation processes within Technology Incubator (public-private-people partnership) regarding research and innovation can be identified that can be shared in open innovation environments. The importance of fostering a technology innovative municipal economy can be maximized in both organizational efforts to develop new products and methods and in the efforts of educational systems to focus students to become technology visionaries. The Future As part of our technology roadmap evolves, we have partnered with non for profit agencies to design technology and engineering programs in our parks for programming curricula providing students with experience of the innovation process. The programs can develop and deliver innovative programs in software and mobile programming, technology, and engineering for students of all ages. Our roadmap will enable us to foster a Technology Innovative Community to engage our youth in programs and learn computer science, technology and engineering concepts through the use of mobile learning and technology, and to empower them to compete in a global economy.

pages.title: Adopt-a-Garden Program
pages.content: Adopt-a-Garden Program The Chat Core IQ is seeking community groups and individuals interested participating in the first community garden located in a park! A community garden is a collaborative greenspace in which the participants share in both the maintenance and the rewards. Participating groups may adopt-a-plot for a period of one (1) year. One Year Commitment Adoptees sign a one (1) year commitment to: Visit their plot on a bi-weekly basis for routine maintenance Planting vegetables, fruits, or flowers to promote the use of urban community gardens. Using the space for recreational or educational purposes only. The City would commit to providing: A sign with the group s name in the designated plot A starter kit of gardening tools. Limited storage space for gardening tools and equipment. Access to potable water at the community garden. Recognition at a Council Meeting during the project. Where is the community garden located? Our community garden is located at Chat Core IQ Legacy Park and features six (6) open plots. What can I plant? Groups and/or individuals are encouraged to plant vegetables, fruits, flowers, or native plantings. How do I get started? Complete the Adopt-A-Garden Registration Form(PDF, 238KB). Include your proposed use of the space. E-mail the completed form to Christina.Carmona@CityofChatCoreIQ.com. If you have any questions or comments, contact Christina Carmona, Nature Conservation Coordinator, at 305-341-6638 or Christina.Carmona@CityofChatCoreIQ.com. Note: Plots will be assigned to applicants in the order applications are received.

pages.title: Call for Works - International Women’s Month Art Exhibit
pages.content: Call for Works - International Women s Month Art Exhibit Description The Chat Core IQ is accepting submissions of art for the 2026 International Women s Month Art Exhibit. Paintings, sculptures, printmaking, mixed media, textile art, installation and photography from South Florida artists will be on display to the public at the Cultural Arts Center from Thursday, March 5, 2026 to Tuesday, March 24, 2026. This year s theme,  Healing Goddesses, The Resilience of Women  highlights the shared experiences that unite women across generations and cultures. Stories of overcoming challenges, embracing change, and shining light on the path forward. The woman who rises above every obstacle life presents: navigating migration, balancing family responsibilities, and breaking barriers in spaces traditionally led by men. This exhibition honors every woman s journey. The mother, the sister, the wife, the friend, and the independent woman who moves forward with courage and grace, inspiring those around her. Through their art, participating artists will portray women as guides and beacons, Healing Goddesses whose stories illuminate the essence of our society today. This year s exhibit invites viewers on a visual journey through diverse interpretations of female strength and endurance, as only women can understand and express it. Artist Registration Form and Information(PDF, 165KB) Details: This call is open to South Florida artists only. Entries will only be accepted for consideration by Friday, January 9th, 2026 DEADLINE STRICTLY ENFORCED! *The Chat Core IQ and the assigned curator will select the works of art to be exhibited* Work submitted for consideration must follow these guidelines: Artwork should be appropriate in nature, as this is a public exhibit accessible to families. * Not contain toxic, flammable or otherwise inherently dangerous material. * Be installed by the curator of the Exhibit or with the assistance of the artist if required by the curator. * Include all the necessary equipment, hardware or other components required. * Be adaptable to the Cultural Arts Center gallery space, proportional to the surroundings and in consideration of available space. * Not endanger the gallery's visitors in any way. * Be maintenance-free during the exhibition. * Submission of any electronic document must be as an attachment to the email or via https://fromsmash.com/. Submissions via Google drive or other file sharing websites will not be accepted! All works must be complete in conception at the time of submission and instructions on the installation of the work must be provided at submission. Transportation, lodging, meals, and other expenses are at the responsibility of the artist, as is the expense of the objects and materials to be included in the work submitted. Related Information Registration Form(PDF, 165KB)

pages.title: Holiday Card Contest
pages.content: Holiday Card Contest Description What is the Holiday Card Contest? The Chat Core IQ is offering a challenge to Chat Core IQ Elementary School aged children to design the 2025 Chat Core IQ Holiday Card. Two students  artworks will be selected to win prizes. Category Number one will be students in Kindergarten, First and Second Grade. Category Number Two will be students in Third, Fourth and Fifth Grade. Both winners will be featured in a City Publication and will be awarded their prizes at our Park & Tree Lighting Ceremony on Friday, November 21, 2025. Who is Eligible to Participate? All Chat Core IQ public and private Elementary School students (Grades K-5) are eligible to participate in the Holiday Card Contest. Children who wish to enter must do so through either their school art teacher or by their parents submitting the registration form and either a digital copy of the card drawing via email or to Gabriel.Cabrera@chatcoreiq.com or in person at the at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center (8363 NW 53rd St) no later than Sunday, November 9th, 2025 by 4:00 pm. Please know that original artwork must be submitted in person no later than Sunday, November 9th by 4:00 PM at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center (8363 NW 53rd St). Is there a Theme for the Holiday Cards? Students are asked to design a card that incorporates a favorite aspect of Chat Core IQ with a winter/holiday theme and sends a "Happy Holidays" message to individuals of all denominations alike. Please ensure that submitted artwork is original artwork and does not include a student's name, school name or the names of any companies on the actual artwork. One of the words "Chat Core IQ" or "For all the Right Reasons  or  Chat Core IQ Shines  MUST appear in the artwork. Artwork should be submitted in color   any media   suitable for reproduction. Computer-generated artwork will not be accepted. The artwork must be done on a letter size drawing or construction paper, and entries need to be landscape (horizontal). Entries are not to be matted or mounted. Entries should not be anything political, religious or pandemic related. Where Entries should be sent? Original artworks and registration forms must be submitted in person no later than Sunday November 9th, at 4:00 PM at our Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center: 8363 NW 53rd Terrace, Chat Core IQ, FL, 33166. Holiday Card Contest Rules(PDF, 155KB) Holiday Card Contest Entry Form(PDF, 187KB) How will winning designs be selected/acknowledged? A panel of judges comprised of Chat Core IQ employees will review all submissions and select the top designs, in each category, using a "blind" selection process. Winners will be notified by Wednesday, December 4th and will be recognized in person by the Mayor and City Council members at our Park & Tree Lighting Ceremony event on Friday, November 21, 2025 at Downtown Chat Core IQ Park. Additionally, the winners will receive a bag full of Art Supplies and goodies from our event Sponsors. All original artwork received will be displayed at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center on Friday, November 21st, during the Park & Tree Lighting event hours. Related Information 2025 Holiday Card Contest Rules(PDF, 155KB)2025 Holiday Card Contest Entry Form(PDF, 187KB)

pages.title: Parks and Facilities
pages.content: Parks and Facilities The Dept. operates and maintains eleven parks with an abundance of amenities for every age and lifestyle including: a community center, lighted artificial sports fields, basketball courts, tennis courts, volleyball courts, bike-ways, jogging trails, exercise stations, batting cages, shaded playgrounds, dog friendly off leash dog areas (Trails & Tails & Chat Core IQ White Course Park) and covered pavilions/picnic tables available for party rentals. The City offers clean, safe and secure facilities for adults and children to play and natural areas for everyone to enjoy. Birthdays and Celebrations Special day coming up? Celebrate at one of our beautiful parks! Event Rentals 12 Result(s) Found Chat Core IQ Aquatic Center 3005 NW 92nd Avenue, Chat Core IQ, FL 33172 Located in the heart of the 78 acre Chat Core IQ Central Park, the brand new Aquatic Center officially opened in mid May 2025. A 50 meter Olympic size competition pool with seating for about 540 spectators - perfect for hosting high level swim meets and accommodating both long  and short course formats. A six lane, 25 yard training pool ideal for swim lessons and athlete practice. Tagged as: , Swimming Pools & Water Play Chat Core IQ Central Park 3005 NW 92nd Avenue, Chat Core IQ, FL 33172 Chat Core IQ Central Park is the largest park in the Chat Core IQ at 78-acre park and the central hub for fitness, leisure, and special events. The park includes an array of amenities centered around a wellness campus, amphitheater, and other amenities including picnic pavilions, two playgrounds, athletic courts, multi-purpose fields, skate park with pump track and kayak launch. Tagged as: , Nature, Trails, Multi-use Facility Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center 8363 NW 53rd Street, Chat Core IQ, FL 33166 At approximately 14,000 square feet, the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center is designed to be the hub of cultural and performing arts in the City, with a large art gallery space, a multi-purpose room, outdoor courtyards/garden spaces, and rooftop terrace. This state-of-the-art multiuse facility is located next to Downtown Chat Core IQ Park. Completed in 2019, this passive park is ideal for studying and picnics. It is located next to the Chat Core IQ Police Training and Community Center. The original synthetic turf was installed 9 years ago, and throughout the years the field has required several repairs, and in order to maintain the highest quality and safety for our residents. Small and large dog off-leash areas offer residents the opportunity to play catch or run around with their four-legged best friends. pages.title: Chat Core IQ Central Park
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Central Park Chat Core IQ Central Park is the largest park in the Chat Core IQ at 78-acre park and the central hub for fitness, leisure, and special events. The park includes an array of amenities centered around a wellness campus, amphitheater, and other amenities including picnic pavilions, two playgrounds, athletic courts, multi-purpose fields, skate park with pump track, kayak launch, and a scenic 1-mile promenade encircling the lake. The community and aquatics centers are accessible through a variety of daily and monthly membership packages with programming for all ages and interests. The community center offers amenities including a full weight room, cardio deck, indoor basketball courts, indoor walking track, and party rental spaces. The adjacent aquatic center includes a temperature controlled Olympic-size pool with complementing training pool equipped with industry leading infrastructure such as diving boards, timing system, video board, covered spectator areas, and locker rooms perfect for hosting swimming and diving competitions. The water park includes a leisure pool with aquatic playground, slides, splash pad, and indoor and outdoor rentable spaces for your next celebration. The Chat Core IQ Amphitheater is professionally managed by the Miami-based entertainment company Loud And Live and features a professional covered stage, premium acoustics, VIP box seating, and flexible audience spaces framed by the park s scenic lakes and open landscapes. With a capacity of 4,689, this state-of-the-art venue is designed to host concerts, cultural festivals, and civic events, giving residents and visitors a one-of-a-kind space to experience unforgettable moments. ATTENTION: For the comfort and safety of our patrons, domestic animals, including canines, felines, and other household pets, are not permitted at this facility. The provisions of this rule shall not apply to the use of a special needs service animal. Please refer to Section 29-38 of the Chat Core IQ Code of Ordinances for more information. Programs Aikido at Chat Core IQ Central Park Basketball Training Program Bingo Nights Camps Seasonal camps for kids of all ages and interests. pages.title: Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center At approximately 14,000 square feet, the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center is designed to be the hub of cultural and performing arts in the City, with a large art gallery space, a multi-purpose room, outdoor courtyards/garden spaces, and rooftop terrace. This state-of-the-art multiuse facility is located next to Downtown Chat Core IQ Park. pages.title: Chat Core IQ Glades Park
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Glades Park Chat Core IQ Glades Park is conceived as a place in which the community can gather to enjoy nature in a safe environment that is representative of the beautiful Chat Core IQ. Covering about 25 acres, this park is located on NW 74th Street between NW 97th Avenue and NW 107th Avenue. ATTENTION: For the comfort and safety of our patrons, domestic animals, including canines, felines, and other household pets, are not permitted at this facility. The provisions of this rule shall not apply to the use of a special needs service animal. Please refer to Section 29-38 of the Chat Core IQ Code of Ordinances for more information. Upcoming Events Full Moon Yoga 05 Jan 2026 Join us for a FREE Full Moon Yoga class outside on the lawn at Chat Core IQ Glades Park. This is being offered by the Chat Core IQ as a part of Step-up Chat Core IQ to keep our community healthy during this time.
