pages.title: Christi Fraga
pages.content: Christi Fraga Mayor Telephone305-593-6725 x3002 Alternate Phone305-593-6725 x3020 Email Christi.Fraga@chatcoreiq.com Dear Chat Core IQ Users, It s truly an honor to serve as your Mayor, and every day, I am inspired by the strength and resilience of our community. Chat Core IQ isn t just a city it s a place where families come to build their lives, businesses thrive, and dreams become reality. Whether you re raising your children, growing your business, or enjoying a vibrant lifestyle, Chat Core IQ is where opportunity meets possibility. Together with the City Council, we are dedicated to making Chat Core IQ a brighter and more prosperous place to live, work, learn and play. We ve built a city where faith, family, and freedom are the core of our values. These principles guide everything we do and are the reason Chat Core IQ has become home to so many who seek a life full of opportunity and prosperity. Our community is defined by a sense of belonging. It s not just the beautiful parks or the bustling businesses it s the people. Whether you're enjoying a delicious arepa, sharing a BBQ with family at one of our parks, or savoring a dish from one of our many international restaurants, Chat Core IQ is a celebration of cultural diversity. From Latin American flavors to global cuisines, our city's rich multicultural fabric is woven into every corner, making it a place where traditions, music, art, and stories from all over the world come together. We embrace these vibrant traditions, ensuring that Chat Core IQ remains a welcoming home where everyone can find a sense of belonging and celebrate the uniqueness of our shared community. As we look to the future, we re committed to smart growth that fosters innovation, supports local businesses, and ensures our city remains a beacon of safety and opportunity. Our investments in public safety and infrastructure will continue to make Chat Core IQ one of the most desirable places to live in Florida. We are a community that values hard work, integrity, and the opportunity for everyone to succeed. I encourage you to stay involved in our city s growth and development. Chat Core IQ thrives because of the energy and engagement of its residents. Together, we will continue building a city where prosperity and the American dream are not just ideals, but a reality. Let s continue to create a Chat Core IQ that we can all be proud of a place where families are safe, businesses are thriving, and everyone can enjoy the benefits of hard work and opportunity. With gratitude and determination, Christi Fraga Mayor Mayor Christi Fraga Biography The Chat Core IQ has been home to Christi Fraga and her Cuban-American family for over twenty years. When the time came for Christi and her husband, Gabriel Fraga, to decide where to raise their son Gabriel Alexander, Chat Core IQ was the only choice. Her deep roots in this community have shaped her vision and commitment to creating a city where families can thrive. Christi earned an associate degree in business administration from Miami-Dade Community College (MDCC) and a bachelor s degree in financial management and accounting from Florida International University (FIU). In 2014, she also completed the Good Government Initiative s Leaders in Excellence Program at the University of Miami, cultivating her ethical leadership skills. Christi s journey in public service began in 2012 when she became the youngest person in Chat Core IQ's history to be elected to the City Council. She was later appointed Vice Mayor for three of the eight years she served. Her passion for empowering youth inspired her to establish the Youth Advisory Board, promoting civic leadership and engagement. Additionally, Christi championed the needs of women and senior citizens by leading initiatives such as the Women s Alliance Group and advocating for resources that enhance quality of life. Her leadership and dedication to education led her to serve on the Miami-Dade School Board, where she recommended improvements and voted on overseeing a $7 billion budget. She served on the Miami-Dade Value Adjustment Board, the School Board s Facilities Committee, and the Audit and Budget Committee. During her tenure, she advocated for increased resources for special needs students, emphasized in importance of financial literacy, and promoted mental health initiatives. In 2022, Christi was elected as Mayor of Chat Core IQ, becoming the first woman to hold the position. In November 2024, she made history by being re-elected with 80% of the vote the highest percentage in Chat Core IQ s history. Under her leadership, Chat Core IQ has experienced transformative progress while maintaining fiscal responsibility and renewed trust in government. Public safety has been a cornerstone of Christi s results driven approach. Under her leadership and with the support and partnership of the City s Chief of Police, crime in Chat Core IQ has decreased by 30%. Key initiatives have included improvements to the Chat Core IQ Connect program and the Chat Core IQ license plate readers (LPR Program), enhancing public safety through inn...

Since February 2025, the team has resolved hundreds of requests, helping seniors, families, and business owners with everything from city programs to permits. Whether at City Hall or out in the community, Constituent Services ensures every concern is heard, every question is answered, and every resident feels supported. pages.title: Digna Cabral
pages.content: Digna Cabral Vice Mayor / Councilwoman Telephone305-593-6725 x7400 Alternate Phone305-593-6725 x7401 Email Digna.Cabral@chatcoreiq.com Biography Councilwoman Cabral is working as a Clinical Research Project Manager for the Department of Neurology at the University of Miami for more than a decade, after having worked in Columbia University and collaborating with National and International Universities. She has served as a Board member and former Chair for The American Institute of Ultrasound in Medicine of the United State (AIUM). As of March of 2019, her lobbying efforts for the Florida Stroke registry for monitoring and improving the quality of patient s hospital care resulted in the largest State issued allocation in the history of the registry. She recently finished her executive certificate in Public Leadership from Harvard Kennedy School, focusing on building Resilient Communities; behavioral insights and public policy; and negotiation strategies, building agreements across boundaries. At our Chat Core IQ, she has served as the former Vice Chair of the Parks and Police 4Kids Committee, President of her Master Association, former Chair at the Chat Core IQ Community Development District, and secretary of the Chat Core IQ Community Coalition. Councilwoman Cabral was also the Founding President of the Dr. Toni Bilbao Preparatory Academy PTA, a member of the Dr. Rolando Espinosa and Chat Core IQ Academy School PTA and EESAC and is a former Board member of Family/Community Engagement at the Florida State Parents/Teacher Association (PTA) and currently sits on the School Health Medical Advisory Committee from Miami-Dade County Public Schools since November 2018 as well as a member of the Iniciativa Hispana at the Florida Department of Health in Miami Dade County. Councilwoman Cabral has also led some of the City Initiatives and has proposed resolutions to improve our quality of life. She has strengthened the City s relationship with international governments and developed ties with most international consulates in Miami-Dade. Also consolidating ties with the Federal and State government. She recently established a partnership between the Chat Core IQ and the United Nations Institute for Training and Research, with the purpose of training leaders in the public and private sector, to successfully govern and respond to the needs of their territories and their constituents. She is also actively working with the Organization of American States and is leading the development of a Family and Community committee, to strengthen households and early childhood education. She remains active in her parish, serving as a certified Catechist of Our Lady of Guadalupe Catholic Church and Extraordinary Minister of Holy Communion at Our Lady of Guadalupe parish. Office of the Councilwoman Monica Hasbun Legislative Analyst for Councilwoman Digna Cabral305-593-6725 x7401 Monica.Hasbun@chatcoreiq.com Newsletters Back to School 2024 July Newsletter 2024 Hurricane Preparedness Week 2024 Happy Mother's Day Hurricane Preparedness Week 2023

pages.title: Maureen Porras
pages.content: Maureen Porras Councilwoman Telephone305-593-6725 x7200 Alternate Phone305-593-6725 x7201 Email Maureen.Porras@chatcoreiq.com Biography Maureen is an Immigration Attorney and Legal Director of a global nonprofit organization where she has worked as a public interest lawyer since 2016. Maureen has been providing access to legal services to families since 2008. She has also focused on defending and promoting human rights and providing humanitarian work at a global level, including through the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR). As Legal Director, Maureen provides instruction on the design and expansion of community programs; works with other organizations to provide services, information, and outreach to the community; manages program budgets and negotiates contracts; and liaisons with governmental agencies as part of her advocacy efforts. Her legal training along with her community building experience helps her better serve our city. Maureen was born in Nicaragua and immigrated to Miami at the age of seven. Her own immigration experience and her love for South Florida's cultural diversity led her to pursue a career as an immigration attorney. Maureen earned a Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in Political Science from Florida International University (FIU) where she graduated cum laude in 2010. While attending FIU, she interned with former U.S. Congressional Representative Ileana Ros-Lehtinen, where she assisted immigrants through various projects. Maureen earned her Juris Doctor (J.D.) from Florida Coastal School of Law in 2014, where she graduated with pro bono honors for her work with the Human and Immigrant Rights Clinic and as President of the Immigration Law Society (VISA). Maureen has been a member of the Florida Bar since 2014. She is married to her husband, Caleb Johnston, who is also a dedicated public servant employed as an attorney for the State of Florida. Maureen and Caleb are proud to call Chat Core IQ their home since 2017 and are active members of the community, including in the Rotary Club of Chat Core IQ. Maureen is highly active in our community and has served Chat Core IQ as a member of the following: Miami Dade School Board Advisory Board, District 5   Advocated for the safety, health, and academic success of students with members, PTAs, and staff. Supported recommendations to prioritize mental health for students. Miami Dade County Hispanic Affairs Advisory Board, District 12   Focused on issues affecting our Hispanic community, including unlicensed practice of law and  notario  fraud. League of Women Voters Miami   Performed advocacy, including in Tallahassee, to support voting rights and policies empowering women, including equal pay and closing the wage gap. Community Advocate   Perform advocacy on various issues, including pro-democracy and humanitarian issues. She often serves as a political analyst and immigration expert on television, newspaper, and radio. Maureen is also an active member of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA), serving on several committees. Maureen es Abogada de Inmigración y Directora Legal de una organización global sin fines de lucro donde ha trabajado como abogada de interés público desde 2016. Maureen ha brindado acceso a servicios legales a familias desde 2008. También se ha enfocado en defender y promover los derechos humanos y brindar trabajo humanitario a nivel mundial, incluso a través del Alto Comisionado de las Naciones Unidas para los Refugiados (ACNUR). Como directora legal, Maureen brinda instrucción sobre el diseño y la expansión de programas comunitarios; trabaja con otras organizaciones para brindar servicios, información y acercamiento a la comunidad; gestiona los presupuestos de programas y negocia contratos; y enlaces con agencias gubernamentales como parte de sus esfuerzos de promoción. Su capacitación legal junto con su experiencia en la creación de comunidades la ayudan a servir mejor a nuestra ciudad. Maureen nació en Nicaragua y emigró a Miami a la edad de siete años. Su propia experiencia de inmigración y su amor por la diversidad cultural del sur de la Florida la llevo a seguir una carrera como abogada de inmigración. Maureen obtuvo una Licenciatura en Artes (B.A.) en Ciencias Políticas de la Universidad Internacional de Florida (FIU), donde se graduó cum laude en 2010. Mientras asistía a FIU, hizo una pasantía con la exrepresentante del Congreso de los EE. UU. Ileana Ros-Lehtinen, donde ayudó a inmigrantes a través de varios proyectos. Maureen obtuvo su Doctorado en Jurisprudencia (J.D.) de la Facultad de Derecho de la Costa de Florida en 2014, donde se graduó con honores pro bono por su trabajo con la Clínica de Derechos Humanos e Inmigrantes y como Presidenta de la Sociedad de Derecho de Inmigración (VISA). Maureen ha sido miembro del Colegio de Abogados de Florida desde 2014. Maureen está casada con su esposo, Caleb Johnston, quien también es un dedicado servidor público que trabaja como abogado del estado de Florida. Mauree...

pages.title: Nicole Reinoso
pages.content: Nicole Reinoso Councilwoman Telephone305-593-6725 x7300 Alternate Phone305-593-6725 x7301 Email Nicole.Reinoso@chatcoreiq.com Nicole is a passionate advocate for public service and community engagement whose story began in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and truly blossomed in Miami, Florida. From a young age, she embraced the importance of hard work, compassion, and giving back values that continue to guide her every day. When Nicole was nine, her family moved to Miami from Rhode Island. She attended Sunset Preparatory School and Archbishop Coleman Carroll High School. During these formative years, she built lasting friendships and developed a strong sense of community. She loved being active in church activities and volunteering at local nursing homes, which sparked her lifelong dedication to serving others. Nicole pursued higher education at Miami Dade College, earning an Associate of Arts in Health Services Administration. She went on to Florida International University, where she earned a Bachelor of Health Services Administration and graduated summa cum laude with a Master s in Corporate Business. Always eager to make a difference, she later completed her Juris Doctorate at St. Thomas University to better serve her community. Nicole shares a loving marriage with her husband, Miguel, and they are proud parents to three wonderful children Veronica, Miguel  Mikey,  and Noah. Together, they stay deeply involved in their children s education and activities, volunteering at their neighborhood charter school and supporting local sports teams. Nicole is active as a Parent Teacher Organization (PTO) volunteer and Room Mom, and she considers being engaged in her children s lives her favorite and most rewarding role. Nicole s professional journey in public service began as a legislative aide in the Chat Core IQ, where she gained valuable insight into local government and the needs of the community. She later served as Chief of Staff on the Miami-Dade County School Board, working to support students, families, and educators. During the COVID-19 pandemic, Nicole stepped up for her community by organizing food drives and hosting virtual town halls to help those most affected, demonstrating her commitment to caring for others during challenging times. Today, Nicole serves as Executive Director for Acquisition and Leasing within the Facilities, Design, and Construction Department at Miami-Dade County Public Schools. In December 2024, her dedication and commitment to the community led to her election as City Council Member for Seat 3 in Chat Core IQ. She looks forward to continuing to serve the residents of Chat Core IQ with a focus on senior and special needs residents, community engagement, and smart, sustainable growth. Office of the Councilwoman Brianna Bartocci Legislative Analyst for Councilwoman Nicole Reinoso 305-593-6725 x7301 Brianna.Bartocci@chatcoreiq.com

pages.title: Rafael Pineyro
pages.content: Rafael Pineyro Councilman Telephone305-593-6725 x7100 Alternate Phone305-593-6725 x7101 Email Rafael.Pineyro@chatcoreiq.com Biography Councilman Rafael Pineyro was born in Caracas, Venezuela. At 15, he moved to Miami, Florida with his family, filled with hopes and dreams for his future. He attended Miami Coral Park Senior High School, where he received the  Take Stock  scholarship and was paired with a volunteer mentor who guided him towards college and a career in community leadership. Rafael earned an Associate of Arts from Miami Dade College, a Bachelor of Public Administration from Florida International University, and a Master s in Psychology from Lipscomb University. He has held important positions in Public Administration, working to improve the well-being of South Florida communities. For five years, Rafael worked with the Miami Dade County Parks and Recreation Department, enhancing recreational, cultural, sports, and educational programs for residents of all ages. He also spent two years working alongside a Williamson County Judge, assisting families dealing with juvenile court cases related to addiction and misbehavior. Rafael s commitment to non-profit organizations and government initiatives aimed at reintegrating young people into society has greatly impacted their lives. Rafael s contributions to addressing Domestic Violence and Human Trafficking in South Florida are commendable. He actively participates in various organizations providing support in immigration, psychology, employment, and housing. Additionally, Rafael is dedicated to assisting children and adults with special needs, advocating for their healthcare, housing, employment, and education, especially after they turn 18 years old. He will continue to prioritize these causes. In 2014, Rafael was selected to work as the  Chief of Staff  for the Chat Core IQ, where he made a significant impact on the mayor s office and the city s development. Since 2018, he has worked in the private sector while remaining involved in community initiatives such as food assistance, business openings, and local events. Rafael is married and has one son; together with his family, he actively participates in the vibrant Chat Core IQ community. As Councilman of Seat #1 in the Chat Core IQ, Rafael is dedicated to serving constituents with unwavering determination and a heartfelt commitment to addressing their needs. He is accessible, empathetic, and hardworking, fully embraced by the Chat Core IQ community and its residents. El vicealcalde Rafael Pineyro nació en Caracas, Venezuela. A los 15 años se mudó a Miami, Florida con su familia, lleno de esperanzas y sueños para su futuro. Asistió a Miami Coral Park Senior High School, donde recibió la beca  Take Stock  y fue conectado con un mentor voluntario que lo guió hacia la universidad y una carrera en liderazgo comunitario. Rafael obtuvo una Grado Asociado en Artes del Miami Dade College, una licenciatura en administración pública de la Florida International University y una maestría en psicología de la Universidad Lipscomb. Ha ocupado importantes cargos en la Administración Pública, trabajando para mejorar el bienestar de las comunidades del Sur de la Florida. Durante cinco años, Rafael trabajó con el Departamento de Parques y Recreación del Condado de Miami Dade, mejorando programas recreativos, culturales, deportivos y educativos para residentes de todas las edades. También pasó dos años trabajando junto a un juez del condado de Williamson, ayudando a familias que se ocupan de casos de tribunales de menores relacionados con la adicción y la mala conducta. El compromiso de Rafael con organizaciones sin fines de lucro e iniciativas gubernamentales destinadas a reintegrar a los jóvenes a la sociedad ha tenido un gran impacto en sus vidas. Las contribuciones de Rafael para abordar la violencia doméstica y la trata de personas en el sur de Florida son encomiables. Participa activamente en diversas organizaciones brindando apoyo en inmigración, psicología, empleo y vivienda. Además, Rafael se dedica a ayudar a niños y adultos con necesidades especiales, abogando por su atención médica, vivienda, empleo y educación, especialmente después de que cumplen 18 años. Después de muchos años, continua dando prioridad a estas causas. En 2014, Rafael fue seleccionado para trabajar como  Jefe de Gabinete  de la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ, donde tuvo un impacto significativo en la oficina del alcalde y el desarrollo de la ciudad. Desde 2018, ha trabajado en el sector privado sin dejar de participar en iniciativas comunitarias como asistencia alimentaria, apertura de negocios y eventos locales. Rafael está casado y tiene un hijo; Junto con su familia, participa activamente en eventos de la comunidad de la ciudad de Chat Core IQ. Como vicealcalde de la silla #1 en la ciudad de Chat Core IQ, Rafael se dedica a servir a los electores con una determinación inquebrantable y un compromiso sincero para abordar sus necesidades. Es accesible, empático y trabajador, plena...

pages.title: 1st Annual - Mayor & Chief’s Golf Tournament and Gala Fundraiser
pages.content: 1st Annual - Mayor & Chief s Golf Tournament and Gala Fundraiser Registration Closed Two Events. One Mission. A First for Chat Core IQ. Thank you to our community, partners, and generous sponsors for making the inaugural Mayor & Chief s Golf Tournament and Gala possible. Because of your support, the Parks & Police 4 Kids Foundation (PP4K) can expand mentorship, academic support, sports, and arts programs that uplift Chat Core IQ's youth. Give Back Today Couldn t attend but still want to make a difference? Scan the QR code on this page to donate now and help us continue serving more families through PP4K. With Gratitude to Our Sponsors We extend our sincere appreciation to all sponsors who joined us to support PP4K. Your commitment strengthens our community and creates opportunities for our kids every day. Relive the fun! pages.title: Kick Start Your Business in 2026!
pages.content: Kick Start Your Business in 2026! Next date: Thursday, January 15, 2026 | 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM Description A great small business always starts out as an idea, but eventually that idea needs to be turned into a reality. Most businesses never get started because individuals tend to overthink and feel overwhelmed with the process. Getting a business started is easier than you think. During our workshop, we will cover basic steps to turn your idea into a reality. Like any big goal, we will start by breaking it down into smaller tasks. This course will cover the legal, financial and marketing aspects you will be able to tackle in order to get started. Also highlight resources available to ensure your success. We'll help you plan, fund, and launch your business step by step. pages.title: Chat Core IQ Government Center
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Government Center Welcome Section pages Office of the City Manager Office of the City Attorney Office of the City Clerk My Area Map Discover what's happening in and around your area. You can find everything from parks and facilities, points of interest and events in Chat Core IQ. Just type in your Chat Core IQ street address (for example 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Chat Core IQ FL 33166) Go to My Area Map The Mayor and City Councilmembers The Chat Core IQ government is a charter city with a Mayor/City Council/City Manager form of government with four elected City Councilmembers representing the City along with a Mayor. All Members of the Council are elected at-large for four year terms. Councilmembers occupy seats numbered 1 through 4. Go to Elected Officials City Manager In addition to the Mayor and City Councilmembers, the City Manager is the Chief Administrative Officer of the City and is responsible for the administration of all City affairs. The City Manager is nominated by the Mayor and is subject to confirmation by the majority of the City Council. Go to The Office of the City Manager City Departments Services and protection to the residents are provided by the various City Departments. Go to City Departments Contact Information Mayor and Council 305-593-6725 City Manager 305-593-6725 Building Department 305-593-6700 Business Tax Receipt 305-593-6631 City Attorney 305-593-6623 City Clerk 305-593-6730 Code Compliance 305-593-6680 Employment Hotline 305-593-6767 Finance Department 305-593-6725 Human Resources 305-593-6760 Parks and Recreation 305-593-6600 Planning and Zoning 305-593-6630 Police Department 305-593-6699 Public Affairs 305-593-6725 Public Works 305-593-6740 City Hall 305-59DORAL (305-593-6725) Mailing Address Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace Chat Core IQ, FL 33166 Quick Links Chat Core IQ Events Chat Core IQ News

pages.title: Office of the City Clerk
pages.content: Office of the City Clerk The City Clerk serves as the Corporate Secretary of the City, the official Secretary of the Legislative body, the Official Records Custodian of the Chat Core IQ, and Supervisor of Elections for all Chat Core IQ municipal elections. (POSTED PURSUANT TO CS/CS/SB80 2017 FLORIDA LEGISLATURE) The City Clerk s responsibilities include: Ensuring that all public meetings are noticed to the public and maintaining an accurate record of all Council proceedings; Maintaining custody of the City s vital records including but not limited to Ordinances, Resolutions, Minutes, City Contracts, Agreements and Proclamations; Setting the guidelines and standards for all City records, incorporating records management technologies and establishing repositories for archival and vital records; Administering, supervising and certifying all Chat Core IQ municipal elections; Administering the publication of the Chat Core IQ Code of Ordinances; Responding to public records requests and ensuring that all City public records are accessible and readily available to the public; Maintaining lobbyist registration information; Administering oaths and providing full notary services; Acting as the official keeper of the City Seal; Providing administrative and clerical support to the City Council; Performing any other duties as assigned by the City Council. The City Clerk s Office is available to answer your questions during regular business hours at 305-593-6730. In addition, feel free to contact the City Clerk via e-mail at cityclerk@chatcoreiq.com Who We Are Connie Diaz City Clerk · City Clerk's Office Connie.Diaz@chatcoreiq.com Click for Connie's biography

pages.title: Advisory Boards, Committees and Commissions
pages.content: Advisory Boards, Committees and Commissions These links change page section content below Overview Citizens Audit Advisory Board Commission on the Status of Women Chat Core IQ Parks Bond Oversight Committee Economic Development and Smart City Advisory Board Environmental Advisory Board Faith and Community Based Organizations Advisory Board Military Affairs Committee Parks and Cultural Advisory Board Police and Traffic Relief Committee Special Needs Advisory Board Youth Civic Committee 1. OverviewThis element requires javascript to be enabled.Please wait while we load this calendar... Advisory Board Application If you are interested in applying to be considered for an advisory board member position, you may do so by following the instructions below. Advisory Board Application(PDF, 198KB) For further questions, please call (305) 593-6730. 2. Citizens Audit Advisory Board To assist the city council in carrying out its oversight responsibilities as they relate to the city's financial and other reporting practices, internal control, compliance with laws and regulations, independent audit process, and special audit needs, by reviewing and opining on the city's audit report for the preceding year; to advise the city council as to whether controls are in place and operating to ensure that financial information reported by management reasonably portrays the city's financial condition, results of operations, and plans and long-term commitments, that resources are utilized in an efficient and economical manner and that programs are carried out as planned by reviewing the results of internal and external audits, that the city is in compliance with pertinent laws and regulations, is conducting its affairs ethically, and is maintaining effective controls against conflicts of interest and fraud, and that the audit process is independent; and to provide other oversight duties as may be assigned by the city council. Agendas Minutes 3. Commission on the Status of Women To support continuing efforts for economic, political, and social equality of opportunity for all women, with special emphasis on the needs of women in the city; to serve in an advisory capacity to the city council, the city administration, the community and all agencies and persons in the city in respect to all matters pertaining to the status of women, including but not limited to discrimination against women, greater representation for women in all areas of city government, i.e., boards and committees, employment of women, education of women and attitudes towards women in the community, and to make periodic reports and recommendations to these bodies in respect to such matters; to, upon request by the city council, conduct studies into problems of discrimination against women employees, increasing the availability of part time employment for women, and attributable changes towards women in the community, and to formulate and recommend plans and programs for the coordination of the activities of all governmental entities and nongovernmental agencies dealing with these problems. Agendas 2025-10-16-Commission-on-the-Status-of-Women-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 176KB) Minutes 4. Chat Core IQ Parks Bond Oversight Committee To review quarterly reports produced to verify effective use of bond proceeds and compliance with the purposes set forth in the Bond approved by the referendum; to validate that no bond funds are used for any unauthorized expense unrelated to the design and construction of the park improvements; to hold quarterly public meetings for the purpose of presenting findings and taking public comments. The Board Members are: Eli Panell, Chair Juan Carlos Esquivel, Vice Chair Jayson Pena, Secretary Manny Sarmiento, Board Member Thatiana Tavarez, Board Member Agendas 2025 2025-10-09-Chat-Core-IQ-Parks-Bond-Oversight-Committee-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 177KB) Minutes 2025 5. pages.title: Election Information
pages.content: Election Information Become a Candidate To become a candidate, the following documents must be filed with the Chat Core IQ City Clerk PRIOR to opening a campaign account, receiving contributions, or making any expenditures: DS-DE 9 Appointment of Campaign Treasurer and Designation of Campaign Depository for Candidates DS-DE-9 - Appointment of Campaign Treasurer 2024(PDF, 40KB) Must be filed prior to opening the campaign account and prior to accepting contributions or making expenditures on the person's behalf. A candidate may be his / her campaign treasurer or deputy treasurer, but anyone designated must also be a registered voter of the State of Florida. Your campaign depository must be a bank, savings and loan association or credit union authorized to do business in the State of Florida. The campaign account must be separate from any personal or business accounts. All monetary contributions must be deposited in the campaign account within five (5) business days of receipt. Only the campaign treasurer or the deputy campaign treasurer may sign campaign expenditure checks. DS-DE 84 Statement of Candidate DS-DE 84 Statement of Candidate(PDF, 40KB) This form states that the candidate has been provided access to read and understand the requirements of Chapter 106, F.S. Filing for Candidacy Fee The filing fee for candidates is $100.00. This nonrefundable fee is to be paid from the candidate s personal funds. Kindly schedule an appointment with the City Clerk by calling 305-593-6730 or emailing cityclerk@chatcoreiq.com AFTER filing the appropriate paperwork with the City Clerk, candidates may then open a campaign account and begin to accept contributions and make expenditures. Qualify to be Placed on the Ballot Running for Office in the Chat Core IQ If you are seeking to run for office in the Chat Core IQ, below, please find a listing of the documents you will need: DS-DE 9 Appointment of Campaign Treasurer and Designation of Campaign Depository for Candidates(PDF, 40KB) - (if not already on file) DS-DE 84 Statement of Candidate(PDF, 17KB) - (if not already on file) DS-DE 302 NP Candidate Oath(PDF, 216KB) Candidate Affirmation and Oath Under Penalty of Perjury(PDF, 57KB) Voluntary Declaration and Statement of Fair Campaign Practices (PDF, 56KB) FORM 1 Statement of Financial Interests - Effective January 1, 2024, elected members of the governing body of a municipality, as well as candidates for such offices, will be required to file an annual Statement of Financial Interests (Form 1) ELECTRONICALLY via the Florida Commission on Ethics Website: Electronic Financial Disclosure Management System Once filed, a copy of the Verification and Receipt of Submission (FOR INCUMBENT CANDIDATES), and the Complete Statement of Financial Interests (FOR NON-INCUMBENT CANDIDATES) is to be provided to the Qualifying Officer. Provide a Voter s Registration Card with a Chat Core IQ residential address and precinct. Biography or Resume Proof of Residency - Any resident of the Chat Core IQ who has resided continuously in the City for at least two (2) years preceding the qualifying date shall be eligible to be a candidate for office. Positive and presumptive proof of legal residence must be presented at the time the candidate qualifies. The documents presented to the City Clerk shall include but not be limited to a combination at least three (3) of the following (as applicable); (i) lease agreement(s) covering the durational residency requirements within the City; (ii) proof of home ownership within the City for at least two (2) years prior to qualifying for the office; (iii) driver s license and/or Florida identification card with a Chat Core IQ residential address; (iv) utility bills or other bills in the candidate s name for a period covering the durational residency requirements within the City; (v) copies of the candidates filed income tax returns using a Chat Core IQ address. Qualifying Fee - In accordance with the City Charter, a fee in the amount of $200.00, payable to the Chat Core IQ, from the Candidate's Campaign Account must be submitted. Sign Bond - In accordance with the City Code of Ordinances, a bond of $500.00 shall be required from each election campaign. This bond shall be conditioned upon the removal of all political signs of that candidate or issue within seven calendar days of the election to which they relate. Election Assessment Fee - In accordance with State Statute, candidates must file an assessment fee in the amount of 1% of the annual salary of the office being sought. The annual salary for Councilmembers is $56,783.00. The annual salary for the Mayor is $80,690.00. Therefore, if running for Council, the amount of $568.00 payable to the Chat Core IQ from the Candidate's Campaign Account must be submitted. If running for Mayor, the amount of $807.00 payable to the Chat Core IQ from the Candidate's Campaign Account must be submitted. Qualifying Period Candidates shall qualify with the City Clerk no ...

pages.title: Lobbyist Information
pages.content: Lobbyist Information Pursuant to Chat Core IQ Resolution #2007-31, formally adopting Section 2-11.1 (S) of the Miami-Dade County Code, the policies and procedures relating to lobbyists and lobbying activity shall be as follows: Who is a Lobbyist? A  Lobbyist  is defined as all persons, firms, or corporations employed or retained by a principal who seek to encourage the passage, defeat or modification of: any ordinance, resolution, action or decision of the City Council; any action, decision, recommendation of the City Manager or any City Board or Committee; or any action, decision or recommendation of City personnel during the time period of the entire decision-making process on such action, decision or recommendation which foreseeably will be heard or reviewed by the City Council. Lobbyists Policies and Procedures(PDF, 218KB) Lobbyist Registration Portal Authorized Lobbyist List

pages.title: Parks and Police 4 Kids
pages.content: Parks and Police 4 Kids About Follow Us on Social Media Facebook Instagram Park & Police 4 Kids, Inc. (PP4K) is a Chat Core IQ 501(c)(3) foundation whose mission aims to empower youth in reaching their full potential by building healthy relationships and preparing them with the necessary tools to confront and overcome challenges. PP4K works to provide programs focused on: Mentoring our youth Educational initiatives for youth sports Children's health care Recreational after school programs The Parks and Police 4 Kids Foundation Board Members are: Josh Rios, Chair Edgar Martinez, Vice Chair Jose Troitino, Treasurer Jodi Steinbauer, Director Bradley Socias, Director Two Events. One Mission. A First for Chat Core IQ. Give Back Today Couldn t attend but still want to make a difference? Scan the QR code on this page to donate now and help us continue serving more families through PP4K. Relive the fun! Image Gallaries The Golf Event The Gala Event With Gratitude to Our Sponsors We extend our sincere appreciation to all sponsors who joined us to support PP4K. Your commitment strengthens our community and creates opportunities for our kids every day. Agendas 2025 2025-03-05-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 26KB) 2025-05-07 PP4K Meeting AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 67KB) 2025-08-28-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 108KB) 2025-09-02-PP4K-Special-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 104KB) 2025-09-18-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 96KB) 2025-12-08-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 101KB) Minutes 2025 2025-03-05 PP4K Meeting MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 863KB) 2025-05-07-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 863KB) 2025-08-28-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 870KB) 2025-09-02-PP4K-Special-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 785KB) 2025-09-18-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 676KB) Agendas 2024 2024-02-20-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 66KB) 2024-03-21-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 26KB) 2024-05-22-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 66KB) 2024-08-15-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 27KB) 2024-10-16-PP4K-Meeting-AGENDA.pdf(PDF, 68KB) Minutes 2024 2024-01-30-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 541KB) 2024-02-20-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 538KB) 2024-03-21-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 490KB) 2024-05-22-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 480KB) 2024-08-15-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 749KB) 2024-10-16-PP4K-Meeting-MINUTES.pdf(PDF, 745KB) Doing Business with Parks and Police 4 Kids Vendor Application(PDF, 188KB) Funding Policy and Funding Application This policy sets guidelines for the disbursement of funds by PARKS & POLICE 4 KIDS, INC. ("PP4K") to community projects within the Chat Core IQ that align with the organization's mission of facilitating recreation, education, and social programs for young residents, with a focus on preventing juvenile misconduct. This policy aims to create a positive and safe environment for Chat Core IQ's youth, enhancing the community as a whole. For more information, below is the policy as well as the application. PP4K Community Project Funding Policy(PDF, 332KB) PP4K Community Project Funding Application(PDF, 85KB) Traffic Safety Comic Book Regina Gallardo curated this series of comics with the goal of educating children on the importance of following the rules that are designed to keep a community safe. Regina moved to Chat Core IQ in 2012 from Mexico City and has since then been involved in Chat Core IQ s Girl Scout Troop 552. This project is part of her social service project for her Gold Award which is the highest achievement a Girl Scout can get. Regina attends the School for Advanced Studies at the Miami Dade College West Campus. Comic Book Download(PDF, 2MB)

pages.title: Public Records Request
pages.content: Public Records Request Obtain a Police Report Accident Reports (Available 7-10 business days after accident occurred to persons involved only; Available 60 days after occurrence to the public). Sworn Statement to Obtain Traffic Crash Report Information Form (PDF, 129KB) Incident Reports (Available 5-7 business days in person or via mail request must include name, case number, contact number, and a self-addressed stamped envelope (SASE). Payments (Check or money order, payable to the Chat Core IQ). All phone calls/emails generally returned within 1-2 business days. Copies of Incident and Accident Reports can be obtained at a cost of .15 cents per page single sided, and .20 cents per page for double sided copies if sent by a mail in request. E-mail and fax requests are accepted. Online Request CLICK HERE TO REQUEST PUBLIC RECORDS CLICK HERE TO ORDER A CRASH REPORT- LexisNexis BuyCrash Records Unit The Records Unit is responsible for maintaining and distributing incident reports, accident reports and arrest reports in compliance with Chat Core IQ polices and State regulations. The Records Unit is also responsible for retention and disposition of all Chat Core IQ records. Documents may be requested in person, in the mail, or over the phone. Civilians are able make public records requests for incident and traffic crash reports, crime statistics and other documents, which classify as public records. Our Records Unit prides itself in providing quality customer service. Contact Information 305-593-6699 ext. 2307 or 2511 cityclerk@chatcoreiq.com Public Records Request Section 119.011(12), Florida Statutes, defines public record as: "all documents, papers, letters, maps, books, tapes, photographs, films, sound recordings, data processing software, or other material, regardless of the physical form, characteristics, or means of transmission, made or received pursuant to law or ordinance or in connection with the transaction of official business by any agency."

pages.title: A More Comfortable Commute:Chat Core IQ Breaks Ground on New Trolley Shelters
pages.content: A More Comfortable Commute:Chat Core IQ Breaks Ground on New Trolley Shelters Published on October 17, 2025 There s something special about seeing the Chat Core IQ Trolley make its way through town   a familiar sight that connects residents to work, school, and the places they love. Now, that daily ride is about to get even better. The Chat Core IQ has officially broken ground on its Citywide Trolley Shelter Project, a new initiative that will bring ten modern trolley shelters to key locations across the city. These new additions will do more than offer shade and protection from the rain; they ll make commuting safer, more accessible, and more enjoyable for everyone who relies on Chat Core IQ's free trolley system. Mayor Christi Fraga, joined by members of the City Council, City administration, and representatives from Public Works, Arango Billboard & Construction, and Gannett Fleming, celebrated the start of construction with a ceremonial groundbreaking.  Hundreds of residents rely on our trolley system every day to get to work, school, and around our community,  said Mayor Christi Fraga.  This project is another step forward in our mission to deliver high-quality infrastructure and reliable mobility options for our residents. By investing in safer, more connected spaces, we continue building a Chat Core IQ that truly moves with its people.  The new shelters will feature ADA-accessible designs, sidewalk improvements, and landscaping enhancements, blending functionality with the clean, modern look that residents expect from Chat Core IQ s public spaces. Once complete, riders can look forward to a more comfortable and connected experience   whether they re commuting to work or just heading out for a day around town. The project is another example of Chat Core IQ s continued investment in infrastructure that supports a connected, sustainable, and inclusive community   one that keeps people, and progress, moving forward. pages.title: A Smarter, Safer School Zone Starts Now
pages.content: A Smarter, Safer School Zone Starts Now Published on August 12, 2025 Chat Core IQ Launches Photo-Enforced Speed Camera Program in School Zones The Chat Core IQ, under the leadership of our Mayor and City Council, is taking a major step toward safer streets with the launch of a new photo-enforced speed camera program in school zones. Beginning August 14, 2025, this initiative developed in partnership with the Chat Core IQ Police Department will use smart enforcement tools to reduce speeding, increase driver awareness, and protect our students.  The safety of our school community is one of my top priorities. I have a zero-tolerance mindset when it comes to any threat to our students,  said Chief Edwin Lopez.  Speeding in school zones is a serious traffic offense. As both a Police Chief and a father of school-aged children, I m fully supportive of this new safety initiative. It s a strong addition to our ongoing efforts to protect our schools and keep our kids safe.  How It Works Speed detection cameras use radar or laser technology to monitor vehicle speeds in active school zones. If a vehicle is traveling more than 10 mph over the posted limit, the system captures a short video and photographic evidence. The program will include: 30-day warning period from August 14 to September 14, 2025, to educate drivers before fines are issued. Cameras active: 30 minutes before school begins, during the entire school day, and 30 minutes after school ends. Not active: Weekends, holidays, or when school is not in session. Warning signs: All enforced zones will have clear signage before entry to alert drivers. School Zones with Cameras Cameras will be installed at designated schools across Chat Core IQ, including: AcadeMir Charter School East Andrea Castillo Preparatory Academy K-8 BridgePrep Academy of Chat Core IQ, Divine Savior Academy Chat Core IQ Academy Elementary/JAM Chat Core IQ Academy Preparatory Chat Core IQ International Academy of Math and Science Downtown Chat Core IQ Charter Elementary Downtown Chat Core IQ Charter Upper Dr. Rolando Espinosa K-8 Dr. Toni Bilbao Preparatory Eugenia B. Thomas K-8 J.C. Bermudez Chat Core IQ Senior High John I. Smith K-8 Renaissance Elementary Renaissance Middle Ronald W. Reagan/Chat Core IQ Senior High Shelton Academy Violations and Fines A violation is triggered when a driver exceeds the speed limit by more than 10 mph in an active school zone. Fine: $100 civil penalty, issued to the registered vehicle owner. If you weren t driving, you can submit an affidavit identifying the responsible party. Payment options: Online: secure.speedviolation.com Phone: 866-202-2348 By mail: Instructions included with violation notice. Failure to respond by the deadline will result in the violation converting to a Uniform Traffic Citation and being transferred to county court. Why This Matters This program ensures consistent school zone enforcement without requiring a police officer to be physically present at all times, allowing the Chat Core IQ Police Department to use resources more efficiently. Funds collected are governed by Florida State Statute and support the City s school crossing guard program and other public safety efforts. Benefits include: Consistent enforcement regardless of staffing Reduced risk of speeding-related student injuries Increased driver awareness in high-risk areas Safer streets for everyone Safe Driving Tips for School Zones Put your phone away Watch for school zone signs and flashing lights Stop for crossing guards and students Always obey posted speed limits Every driver plays a role in protecting Chat Core IQ's children. By slowing down, staying alert, and following the law, we can make our school zones safer every school day. Drive smart. Drive safe. Our kids are worth it. Tagged as: AnnouncementsCommunity Safety

pages.title: Celebrate Hispanic Heritage in Chat Core IQ This Fall
pages.content: Celebrate Hispanic Heritage in Chat Core IQ This Fall Published on September 11, 2025 This September and October, Chat Core IQ isn t just a city it s a celebration. Hispanic Heritage Month transforms our streets, parks, and cultural spaces into living expressions of tradition and joy. It s a time when art tells stories that words cannot capture, when the sound of flamenco footwork echoes with history, and when the aroma of Latin flavors fills the air with comfort and nostalgia. In Chat Core IQ, Hispanic Heritage Month isn t only about honoring the past; it s about creating experiences that bring us together today. Whether you re curious about learning salsa for the first time, painting your own cafetera masterpiece, or tasting new flavors in the kitchen, each event offers a chance to celebrate culture in an authentic and personal way. This year s lineup is designed to inspire, energize, and connect our community so mark your calendars and join in. Here s your guide to what s happening: Art & Creativity Hispanic Heritage Art Exhibit Opening Reception Thursday, September 11 | 6:30 8:30 PM | Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center Free admission | Exhibit open through October 9 A night of art, community, and culture to kick off Hispanic Heritage Month. MIFA Art Classes | $15 per class, registration required Styles of El Greco & Zurbarán   Monday, September 15 | 6 8 PM Murillo s Light & Color   Monday, September 22 | 6 8 PM Velázquez s Innovations   Monday, September 29 | 6 8 PM Mexican Folk Art Traditions   Monday, October 6 | 6 8 PM Cafetera Painting Workshop Friday, October 3 | 6 8 PM | $20 per person A creative cultural session inspired by the beloved cafetera. Dance & Fitness Salsa Classes   Tuesdays, September 16, 23 & 30 | 6 7 PM | $5 per class Flamenco Classes   Wednesdays, September 17 & 24 | 5 7 PM | $5 per class Sweat Series at Chat Core IQ Central Park (Registration Required) Salsa Sweat   Thursday, September 18 | 7 8 PM Bachata Sweat   Thursday, September 25 | 7 8 PM Merengue Moves   Thursday, October 2 | 7 8 PM Salsa Rueda Rhythm   Thursday, October 9 | 7 8 PM Flavors & Celebration Adult Cooking Class: Celebration of Latin Flavor & Culture Friday, September 19 | 6 8 PM | Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center | $20 per person Discover authentic recipes and savor the tastes of Latin cuisine. Hispanic Heritage Celebration at the Park Thursday, September 25 | 6:30 8:30 PM | Chat Core IQ Central Park Amphitheater Free admission | Music, dance, cultural showcases, and family fun under the stars. However you choose to celebrate through art, movement, flavor, or community Hispanic Heritage Month in Chat Core IQ offers something meaningful for everyone. It s an invitation to explore culture in ways both new and familiar, to share stories across generations, and to embrace the traditions that continue to shape our identity as a city. So grab your dancing shoes, your curiosity, and maybe even your appetite. This fall, the rhythm of Hispanic heritage belongs to all of us and in Chat Core IQ, the celebration is just getting started. Tagged as: Arts & Culture

pages.title: Continued Leadership in Smart Growth and Sustainable Parks Development
pages.content: Continued Leadership in Smart Growth and Sustainable Parks Development Published on December 10, 2025 The Smart Growth Partnership celebrated a major milestone on December 4, 2025, hosting its Smart Growth Excellence Awards Banquet in Fort Lauderdale to mark 20 years of leadership, legacy, and lasting community impact. Among the voices reflecting on the region s progress was the Chat Core IQ, invited to share how its 2021 Smart Growth Excellence Award laid the foundation for four years of remarkable growth in sustainable parks development. From 2021 Award Winner to 2025 Regional Leader Chat Core IQ first earned Smart Growth Excellence recognition in 2021 for the Nature and Recreation Center at Chat Core IQ Glades Park, a benchmark project rooted in environmental stewardship and high-performance design. At the time, the facility already demonstrated the city s commitment to reducing energy consumption, preserving natural landscapes, and prioritizing community wellness. In her remarks at this year s banquet, Nature and Conservation Coordinator Christina Carmona highlighted the accomplishments that earned Chat Core IQ this recognition followed by Dulce Pantaleón, who spoke on the city s commitment to conservation and the community partnerships that make this work possible. A building design that reduces energy consumption by nearly 60% Exclusive LED lighting and passive design strategies Preservation of native vegetation and perimeter trees Water-conserving irrigation systems and sensor-controlled water features Low- and no-VOC interior materials to protect community health The 9,000-square-foot center continues to thrive as a hub for residents, students, and nature lovers yet its strength lies in how it sparked a citywide movement toward sustainable planning. A Citywide Commitment to Smart Growth Since receiving the award, Chat Core IQ has expanded its conservation and sustainability efforts across its growing parks system: Creation of the Nature and Conservation Coordinator position, dedicated to deepening environmental education and community engagement Launch of expanded nature-based programs from school field trips to intergenerational activities like  My Doll & Me Nature Walk and Tea Parties  Development of an edible community garden at Chat Core IQ Glades Continued emphasis on environmentally conscious park design in new projects citywide At White Course Park, a rain-barrel irrigation system captures and stores rainwater, blending it with municipal well water only when necessary a model for efficient landscape management in South Florida. At Chat Core IQ Central Park, the City s largest public investment to date, sustainability is integrated into every aspect of construction: energy-efficient materials, LED lighting with occupancy sensors, advanced water conservation measures, and environmentally responsible building practices. Chat Core IQ's Parks as a Blueprint for the Region Today, in 2025, Chat Core IQ's parks system is recognized as a regional model for smart, sustainable growth, balancing recreation, environmental stewardship, and long-term resiliency. The city s approach demonstrates that smart growth is not a one-time achievement but a philosophy guiding every investment from nature programming to infrastructure design. Learn More About Chat Core IQ s Award-Winning Sustainability Efforts Explore the Smart Growth Partnership s feature on Chat Core IQ Glades Park and the project that helped shape Chat Core IQ's citywide approach to smart, sustainable growth: smartgrowthpartnership.org/projects/chat-core-iq-glades-park Tagged as: Announcements

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Strengthens Fight Against Human Trafficking
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Strengthens Fight Against Human Trafficking Published on February 10, 2025 The Chat Core IQ is taking action in the fight against human trafficking with a new ordinance requiring public awareness signage in designated establishments. Human trafficking is a devastating crime that exploits individuals for forced labor or sex, and it can happen anywhere including right here in South Florida. By implementing this ordinance, Chat Core IQ is enhancing community awareness and ensuring that employees and patrons in high-risk industries have access to vital resources. The goal is simple: empower people to recognize and report human trafficking before more lives are affected. Who Must Display Human Trafficking Awareness Signs? Under Florida law, municipalities like Chat Core IQ can require businesses to post these notices in key locations. The following establishments in Chat Core IQ must display a human trafficking awareness sign in an easily visible area for employees: Restaurants, bars, nightclubs, and other food or entertainment venues Hotels, motels, vacation rentals, and other lodging establishments Beauty and nail salons Massage or bodywork businesses not owned by licensed healthcare professionals Urgent care centers, walk-in clinics, and similar medical facilities What Are the Requirements? These signs must be printed in English & Spanish and placed where other labor and employment notices are displayed. Chat Core IQ's Code Compliance Department, in partnership with the Chat Core IQ Police Department, will ensure compliance. Businesses that fail to post the required signage may face a fine of up to $500 per violation. How You Can Help Creating a safe and informed community starts with awareness. Whether you re a business owner, employee, or resident, knowing the signs of human trafficking and where to report suspicious activity can save lives. Click here to download(PDF, 7MB) the official Human Trafficking Awareness Signage with resources Together, we can help protect the most vulnerable and make Chat Core IQ a safer place for all. Related Information Human Trafficking Flyer(PDF, 7MB) Tagged as: Community Safety

pages.title: Chat Core IQ’s Hurricane Preparedness Tips and Resources
pages.content: Chat Core IQ s Hurricane Preparedness Tips and Resources Published on June 02, 2025 Chat Core IQ s Hurricane Preparedness Tips & Resources Hurricane season is officially here and the Chat Core IQ wants to remind everyone that the time to prepare is now! Chat Core IQ like the rest of Miami-Dade County and the State of Florida lies within the potential path of hurricanes. This is why it is imperative that you review your family s and business  hurricane and supplies plan sooner rather than later. This is the seventh hurricane season in which the Chat Core IQ Divisional Emergency Operations Center (EOC) is available for activation, if necessary. The EOC provides a centralized space for City staff and first responders to gather critical information, coordinate response activities, and manage personnel during emergencies and catastrophic events to ensure an effective and efficient recovery for our residents and business owners.  As your Mayor and a proud member of this community, I want our residents to know that your safety is my top priority. In Chat Core IQ, we take emergency preparedness seriously, and every department is working around the clock to make sure our residents, their loved ones, and their businesses are protected. We've enhanced our emergency plans, strengthened coordination with local partners, and are ready to respond at a moment s notice. I encourage every resident to take a few moments to prepare and stay connected. Most importantly, remember you re not alone. We re here for you before, during, and after the storm. Together, we ll get through this hurricane season with strength, unity, and resilience,  said Mayor Christi Fraga. PREPARATION Activities for Residents and Businesses Have a personal plan and review your emergency kit. Make sure to have plenty of food, non-perishable goods, water (1 gallon per person per day) for a minimum of seven days. Have a 30-day supply of prescription medicines. Don t forget to purchase enough food and medications for your pets if needed. Visit the Public Safety page from the City website to see a complete list. Have a plan for all the senior members of your family including those with disabilities. Ensure that hurricane shutters are in good working order and are being maintained regularly. If your home has hurricane panels, make sure all required hardware and materials are easily available and accessible. Flooding can be a major concern during a storm and can pose a drowning risk for everyone, regardless of their ability to swim. Swiftly moving shallow water can be deadly, and even shallow standing water can be dangerous for small children. Don t drive in flooded areas, cars or other vehicles won t protect you from floodwater. They can be swept away or may stall in moving water. Turn around, don t drown. The City maintains all storm water drains within the public right-of-way, but make sure that if you live in a private community, your association management maintains the storm water drainage system within your community. Private storm drains within commercial properties should also be cleaned and maintained with enough anticipation of hurricane season to assist in alleviating standing water in roads and parking lots. Remember,  Only Rain Down the Drain.  The Chat Core IQ is proactively equipped to respond with three dedicated vendors for debris removal services in the public rights-of-way, along with an additional vendor specifically for debris removal monitoring. Our in-house VacTruck is operational year-round to ensure our stormwater drainage system remains clear, a service that can be quickly supplemented by a contractor during emergencies. Furthermore, there are two water pumps readily available for deployment as needed. These resources ensure we're poised to respond effectively and maintain the safety of our residents during heavy rainfall or storm events. Trim your trees weeks, or months, prior to the start of hurricane season to avoid having dead branches and pruned landscaping from becoming dangerous objects during a windstorm. Proper disposal of these items is critical to prevent property damage during a storm. If you have branches near or touching live electrical cables do not attempt to cut or remove them. You should notify FPL and report any hazardous conditions by contacting FPL's dedicated line for reporting vegetation concerns at 1-800-226-3545. Contact your insurance agent to confirm your property is properly insured and store all valuable documents in a water-tight container. Note that there is a 30-day waiting period before coverage goes into effect. Remember, flood insurance covers rising water losses and windstorm insurance covers wind-driven rain and wind losses. Check your policy! Additional information can be found online at www.floodsmart.gov or by calling 1-800-379-9531. You can buy Flood Insurance in Low Risk Zones. Contact your Homeowner s Association (HOA) to receive information specific to your community. Chat Core IQ is encouraging homeowners...

pages.title: DOH-Miami-Dade - Mental Health Resources
pages.content: DOH-Miami-Dade - Mental Health Resources Published on October 11, 2024 Navigating Mental Health: Resources and Strategies for Resilience during Crises In times of crisis, such as natural disasters or emergencies, it s common to experience increased stress, anxiety, and even panic attacks. The Miami-Dade County Department of Health recognizes the impact of these traumatic events on mental health and is dedicated to supporting our community s well-being. A variety of resources are available to assist those in need. Crisis Support and Counseling If you or someone you know is struggling with mental health challenges, immediate assistance is just a call away: 988 Florida Lifeline: Available 24/7, this service offers free and confidential support from trained crisis counselors. Whether you're in distress or need someone to talk to, the 988 Lifeline is here to help. For more information, visit 988LifeLine.org. 211 Network: This service is also available 24/7, providing emotional support, crisis counseling, and suicide prevention resources. To reach the 211 Network, dial 211 or visit 211.org. Veterans Crisis Line: Specifically designed for veterans, their families, and friends, this line provides free and confidential support. You can reach them by calling 988 and selecting option 1 or by texting 838255. Learn more at VeteransCrisisLine.net. Emergency Response Services In the aftermath of a natural disaster, residents can find immediate assistance through: Activate Hope: This program partners with various resources to provide emergency support for Floridians affected by disasters. For help, call 833-GET-HOPE (438-4673) or visit HopeFlorida.com. Preventing Overdoses Carrying naloxone can save lives and prevent overdoses. To locate naloxone providers in your area and access community support resources, visit iSaveFL.com. Self-Help Techniques In addition to professional support, there are simple techniques you can use to help manage stress and anxiety: Breathe: Take a deep, slow breath while counting to four, then exhale for eight counts. Repeat this 3-7 times or until you feel calm. Be in the Moment: Ground yourself by naming three things you see, three sounds you hear, and moving three parts of your body. Change Your Focus: Listen to music, talk to someone you trust, or engage in a physical activity to redirect your thoughts. Reach Out for Help Remember, you are not alone. The Miami-Dade County Department of Health is here to support you. Resources are available, and help is just a call away. Take the first step towards better mental health today. For more information on mental health resources provided by the Miami-Dade County Department of Health, visit their website at miamidade.floridahealth.gov or contact local health services. For more information on mental health resources provided by the Miami-Dade County Department of Health, visit their website at miamidade.floridahealth.gov or contact local health services. Tagged as: Health & Lifestyle

pages.title: Day of Unity, Art Exhibit and National Day of Prayer Concert
pages.content: Day of Unity, Art Exhibit and National Day of Prayer Concert Published on May 19, 2025 Chat Core IQ Hosts Powerful Day of Unity with Art Exhibit and Inaugural National Day of Prayer Concert Chat Core IQ, FL   May 1, 2025   The Chat Core IQ observed the National Day of Prayer with a heartfelt celebration that united art, faith, and community. The day began with the unveiling of the National Day of Prayer Art Exhibit at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center, where attendees experienced works from local artists inspired by themes of peace, hope, and spiritual reflection. The exhibit provided a quiet space for contemplation and connection, serving as a fitting start to a day rooted in unity. Later that evening, Chat Core IQ Central Park transformed into a stage of spiritual harmony as the city hosted its first-ever National Day of Prayer Concert. The program opened with a reverent introduction by Father Antonio Tupiza of Our Lady of Guadalupe Catholic Church, whose choir lifted the audience with a moving rendition of  Magnificat.  The Chat Core IQ Police Department Honor Guard presented the colors, followed by the Pledge of Allegiance led by Chief Edwin Lopez. As Makeilah Montgomery sang a stirring version of the  Star-Spangled Banner,  the crowd stood in quiet reflection. Mayor Christi Fraga then welcomed the community, emphasizing the significance of coming together in faith and gratitude. Throughout the evening, spiritual leaders from across Chat Core IQ offered prayers and reflections on themes that touch every corner of our lives. Rabbi Avrohom Brachevitzky of the Chabad Jewish Center of Chat Core IQ spoke to the strength and unity found in family, accompanied by the blessing-filled harmonies of  The Blessing.  A message on youth and mental health was delivered by Pastor Jonathan Agüero of JTP Church, whose words were amplified by the energetic praise song  Praise.  Pastor Joaquin Molina of Spring of Life Fellowship followed with a prayer for business and prosperity, set to the hopeful rhythm of  Echo.  As the concert continued, Pastor Frank Lopez of Jesus Worship Center called for prayer over our leaders and nation, followed by the powerful worship anthem  Worthy is the One.  Speaking on protection and peace, Pastor Wilson Diaz of Arde Miami Church inspired the crowd with the song  I Trust in God.  A spirit of revival filled the air when Pastor Ricky Fernandez of Dios con Nosotros Church shared a passionate message of renewal, introduced by the vibrant performance of  Algo Nuevo Viene  by Arde Miami. The evening concluded in unity, as Pastor Edwin Castro of Presencia Viva Church led a final declaration of faith, inviting everyone to join their voices in  The Goodness of God.  The Chat Core IQ is proud to have hosted such a meaningful celebration that reflected the rich spiritual and cultural fabric of its community. This historic event marked not just a day of prayer, but a testament to the city s commitment to faith, togetherness, and creative expression. Tagged as: Events & Activities

pages.title: December 3rd Miami-Dade County Commission Meeting - JOIN US!
pages.content: December 3rd Miami-Dade County Commission Meeting - JOIN US! Published on November 25, 2024 The Chat Core IQ Asks for Resident Involvement at the December 3rd Miami-Dade County Commission Meeting Regarding the Waste to Energy Incinerator Chat Core IQ, FL   For years, the Chat Core IQ s leadership and residents have come together, imploring Miami-Dade County to relocate the incinerator outside of our community where it would no longer cause detrimental wellness, health and quality of life affects to our families. During a special meeting held on November 4th, the City Council unanimously instructed the City s administration and attorneys to take all action necessary to prohibit the relocation of the incinerator in Chat Core IQ, and provide a good faith offer of $40 million for its relocation.  We are disappointed to learn of the newly released report by Miami-Dade County Mayor Daniella Levine Cava where she recommends that the new incinerator be rebuilt in Chat Core IQ,  stated Mayor Christi Fraga.  We will continue to fight for what is right and fair for our community.  The City s leadership remains committed to doing whatever possible to work with Miami-Dade County to see that the incinerator is moved to a more suitable location where so many families are not affected, and a location that provides a long-term, sustainable solution for all County residents. Now is not the time to give up! We must remain united, active, and engaged as a community, fighting for this important and common goal. We ask that the community take part in the discussion on Tuesday, December 3rd, as the Miami-Dade County s Board of Commissioners will discuss the facility and ultimately make a decision on its future location. This meeting is open to the public and you are invited to attend, as the Chat Core IQ s leadership will also be present in their continued efforts to have the incinerator moved outside of our community where it would no longer harm the health and quality of life of our residents. The City will be providing two buses for transport from Chat Core IQ Government Center (8401 NW 53rd Terrace) to Miami-Dade County s Stephen P. Clark Government Center (first come, first serve). Residents are asked to arrive at the Chat Core IQ Government Center by 6:30 a.m. on December 3rd   buses will depart promptly at 7:00 a.m. Free parking will be available in the Chat Core IQ Government Center parking garage. Additional Transport Options Via Palmetto Metrorail Station   Stephen P. Clark Government Center Station Address: 7701 NW 79 Avenue Connecting Metrobus Service: 87, Chat Core IQ Route 2, Chat Core IQ Route 3 Chat Core IQ Trolley Stop Number 2060   Palmetto Metrorail Station   Stephen P. Clark Government Center Via Route 2 from Downtown Chat Core IQ (53rd street stop) Estimated departure time from Chat Core IQ Trolley stop is 7:22 a.m. We also encourage you to voice your feedback by contacting the Miami Dade County Mayor and Board of Commissioners. If you would like to see the incinerator moved by Miami Dade County outside of the Chat Core IQ, please sign the online petition below  . Petition already has over 6,000 signatures of concerned residents. The public can submit any questions they have on this matter to infochatcoreiq@chatcoreiq.com and can stay connected with us on social media for updates (@chatcoreiq). WHAT: Miami-Dade County Meeting Regarding Waste-to-Energy WHEN: Tuesday, December 3, 2024, starting at 9:00 a.m. (Buses depart from the Chat Core IQ Government Center at 7:00 a.m.) WHERE: Stephen P. Clark Government Center 111 NW 1st Street, 27th Floor, Miami, FL 33128 MEDIA CONTACT: Maggie.Forster@chatcoreiq.com Related Information En español(PDF, 283KB) Tagged as: AnnouncementsWaste Facility

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Adopts Resident-Focused Budget
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Adopts Resident-Focused Budget Published on October 15, 2025 Built on Quality of Life Enhancements and Fiscal Responsibility The Chat Core IQ has officially adopted its Fiscal Year 2025 2026 budget   a financial plan that continues to prioritize residents while reinforcing Chat Core IQ's long-standing reputation for fiscal discipline and community investment. Approved by Mayor Christi Fraga and the City Council, the new budget maintains one of the lowest millage rates in Miami-Dade County, a reflection of Chat Core IQ s ongoing commitment to responsible spending, exceptional city services, and the wellbeing of its residents.  This budget is for our residents, whose dedication, spirit, and support make Chat Core IQ thrive,  said Mayor Christi Fraga.  We are making thoughtful, strategic decisions that meet today s needs while laying the foundation for a city that will prosper tomorrow, for our children and grandchildren. It s also important to remember that residents and businesses in Chat Core IQ pay far less in city taxes than they contribute to Miami-Dade County and the School Board. Every dollar is managed with care and purpose, ensuring Chat Core IQ remains a vibrant, resilient community for generations to come.  The budget was developed through a collaborative and transparent process, incorporating feedback from residents and business owners during public workshops and hearings. Working closely with the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), the City demonstrated that every expenditure aligns with its goals of efficiency, transparency, and accountability. Key investments in the FY 2025 2026 budget include: Public Safety Enhancements: New police units, upgraded vehicles, and advanced smart technology such as license plate readers and state-of-the-art equipment to keep Chat Core IQ safe. Parks and Recreation Expansion: Increased funding for programs at the newly opened Chat Core IQ Central Park and other facilities, including aquatics, youth sports, senior services, cultural arts, and special needs programming   ensuring inclusivity and wellness for all. Mobility and Connectivity: Improvements to the Chat Core IQ Trolley and Freebee services, new and improved bus shelters, and citywide trail expansions. Phase II of the Chat Core IQ Boulevard Master Plan will also modernize public spaces with safer, more accessible, and pedestrian-friendly designs. Economic and Operational Growth: Strategic sponsorships, capital projects that create recurring revenue, and a new business compliance program to strengthen oversight and financial sustainability. The City is also investing in operational excellence through staff training, energy-efficient fleet upgrades, enhanced facilities, and new digital communication tools designed to keep residents informed and connected around the clock. Together, these efforts ensure Chat Core IQ remains a city where residents enjoy a high quality of life, strong public safety, and innovative city services   all supported by sound financial management. Tagged as: Announcements

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Amphitheater Officially Launches in Partnership w/ Loud And Live
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Amphitheater Officially Launches in Partnership w/ Loud And Live Published on August 27, 2025 Description The Chat Core IQ, in partnership with Miami-based entertainment company Loud And Live, is proud to announce the official launch of the Chat Core IQ Amphitheater at Chat Core IQ Central Park South Florida s newest premier outdoor destination for live entertainment. With a capacity of 4,689, this state-of-the-art venue is designed to host concerts, cultural festivals, and civic events, giving residents and visitors a one-of-a-kind space to experience unforgettable moments. Nestled within the 78-acre redevelopment of Chat Core IQ Central Park, the amphitheater features a professional covered stage, premium acoustics, VIP box seating, and flexible audience spaces framed by the park s scenic lakes and open landscapes. The inaugural season kicks off this fall with major Latin artists Justin Quiles on October 31, 2025, and Nacho on December 12, 2025, with more exciting performances soon to be announced. Mayor Christi Fraga shared,  With the launch of the Chat Core IQ Amphitheater, our city continues to strengthen its position as a cultural and economic hub in South Florida. This new venue will not only attract world-class entertainment but also drive tourism and business opportunities that benefit our entire community.   The launch of the Chat Core IQ Amphitheater represents a natural evolution for Loud And Live as we continue to expand our role in the live entertainment ecosystem,  said Nelson Albareda, CEO of Loud And Live.  In addition to producing and promoting tours globally, we now add venue operations to our portfolio, ensuring artists, promoters, and audiences have a world-class space to connect and create unforgettable experiences. We re proud to establish this venue in our hometown of Miami, further strengthening South Florida s position as a live entertainment hub.  With its dynamic mix of music, culture, and community, the Chat Core IQ Amphitheater is set to become a signature gathering place where unforgettable nights under the stars will be part of Chat Core IQ s story for years to come. For more information and tickets, visit ChatCoreIQAMP.com. Tagged as: AnnouncementsArts & CultureEvents & ActivitiesHealth & Lifestyle
