pages.title: Chat Core IQ Celebrates Growth, Safety, & Community at 2025 State of the City
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Celebrates Growth, Safety, & Community at 2025 State of the City Published on October 27, 2025 The Chat Core IQ came together for an inspiring evening at Trump National Chat Core IQ, where Mayor Christi Fraga delivered her 2025 State of the City Address before an audience of City Council members, community leaders, residents, and sponsors who have all played a part in shaping the city s success story. With a message centered on unity and progress, Mayor Fraga reflected on a year filled with achievements that strengthened the heart of Chat Core IQ   from public safety and world-class parks to smarter infrastructure and strong, transparent finances. A highlight of the night was the completion of Chat Core IQ Central Park, now one of Miami-Dade County s largest and most dynamic green spaces. The park s new Community & Fitness Center and Aquatic Facility have quickly become hubs of activity, offering learn-to-swim lessons, lap swimming, water fitness, and even a competitive swim program. Through an exciting new partnership, Florida International University s Swim & Dive Team now calls the Chat Core IQ Aquatic Center home. Mayor Fraga also celebrated Chat Core IQ's expanding programs for seniors and residents with special needs, as well as the city s growing calendar of beloved community events. Among them were the return of July 4th at Chat Core IQ Central Park and the incredible success of the Mayor & Chief s Charity Golf Tournament and Gala, which raised more than $300,000 to benefit Parks and Police 4 Kids. Many of the night s attendees and sponsors were recognized for their contributions to this achievement. Public safety remained at the forefront of the Mayor s message. Fraga highlighted that 43% of the City s municipal budget is dedicated to keeping families safe   the largest investment in Chat Core IQ s history. That funding supports new officers and Police Service Aides, specialized units like Fraud and Aggressive Driving, technology upgrades, and department reaccreditation. She also honored life-saving acts by officers, including Officer Jhojan Gallo, and shared plans for a modern, centrally located Police Headquarters designed to support training and preparedness for years to come. On the infrastructure and mobility front, Mayor Fraga noted more than $5.5 million in investments this year to reduce flooding, enhance drainage, and beautify city streets. With expanded Chat Core IQ Trolley and Freebee services, upgraded lighting and signals, and a new trolley shelter project underway, residents are seeing the benefits of safer, more accessible travel throughout the city. The Mayor also reaffirmed her commitment to long-awaited improvements along NW 25th Street, promising to keep pushing for the progress Chat Core IQ deserves. Financially, Chat Core IQ's outlook continues to shine. The City earned back-to-back AAA bond ratings from S&P and Fitch and received top honors from the Government Finance Officers Association for transparency and excellence. The FY 2026 budget remains balanced with strong reserves and innovative revenue strategies   from public-private partnerships to smart, long-term investments that reduce reliance on property taxes while funding key community priorities.  We ve strengthened public safety, delivered the transformative Chat Core IQ Central Park, invested in flooding and mobility solutions, and done it with discipline and transparency,  said Mayor Christi Fraga.  When we work together, we achieve more. Our commitment is to keep Chat Core IQ safe, connected, and opportunity-rich, for our families today and for the generations to come.  The evening also spotlighted new initiatives aimed at innovation and efficiency, including Launch45, a pilot program to help qualified businesses open in under 45 days; Fire plans review now conducted within the City s Building Department; a volunteer-built Virtual Mayor tool improving resident service access at no cost; and seed funding for a startup incubator to support local entrepreneurs. As the event concluded, the atmosphere was one of pride and optimism. Surrounded by council members, residents, and partners who share in Chat Core IQ s success, the 2025 State of the City served as a celebration of how collaboration, vision, and community spirit continue to move Chat Core IQ forward. pages.title: Chat Core IQ Central Park Opens as the City’s Crown Jewel
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Central Park Opens as the City s Crown Jewel Published on May 22, 2025 A new era of recreation, wellness, and community begins The wait is over. Chat Core IQ Central Park, the crown jewel of our city s parks system, is now officially open in its entirety. At 78 acres, this destination is the largest and most dynamic public space in our history, setting a new standard for what a city park can be. The grand opening celebration took place this past weekend, with an official ribbon-cutting on Saturday followed by a full day of public access on Sunday. Residents, families, and city leaders gathered to mark the occasion and experience the park s newest features for the very first time.  This isn t just the opening of a park   it s the realization of a dream we ve shared as a community,  said Mayor Christi Fraga.  Chat Core IQ Central Park is a promise fulfilled   the result of countless conversations, tireless work, and a shared belief that our residents deserve something extraordinary. When I look around, I don t just see amenities   I see birthday parties, morning jogs, weekend picnics, first steps, and lifelong memories. I poured my heart into this because I believe in our city and what we can achieve together. This park is part of our legacy   a place where every generation will connect, belong, and thrive. And this is only the beginning.  The final phase of the park s development introduced two major facilities that anchor this citywide destination: A state-of-the-art Aquatic Center, featuring a 50-meter Olympic-size competition pool, leisure pool, splash pad, training pool, locker rooms, and grandstand seating. Built to serve local schools and universities, it provides a competition-caliber space for swim teams to train and compete. An 80,000-square-foot Community Center, overlooking the lake and equipped with a modern fitness facility, indoor running track, double gymnasium, classrooms, teen and senior lounges, an art room, child watch, a teaching kitchen, indoor play areas, and a café with scenic views. These new additions join the popular outdoor amenities introduced in 2024 including the skate park, amphitheater, playgrounds, kayak launch, fitness stations, sports courts, and shaded picnic areas transforming Chat Core IQ Central Park into a year-round hub for recreation, wellness, and connection. From swim lessons and art classes to wellness workshops and senior programming, the park was designed with every generation in mind. It promotes active lifestyles, expands access to inclusive programming, and offers secure, thoughtfully designed spaces staffed by trained professionals. The City extends its heartfelt thanks to the community for its continued support and to Level 1 sponsors Baptist Health and Univision, whose partnership helped bring this celebration to life. Chat Core IQ Central Park is the flagship project of the voter-approved Chat Core IQ Parks Bond, representing years of investment in the quality of life of our growing city. For more information, visit www.chatcoreiqparksbond.org. Tagged as: Events & Activities

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Community Shines at I AM MDC Day Parade
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Community Shines at I AM MDC Day Parade Published on September 04, 2025 On Tuesday, September 2, 2025, Chat Core IQ's streets were filled with music, laughter, and school spirit as the Chat Core IQ and Miami Dade College (MDC) West Campus came together for the annual I AM MDC Day parade. The celebration honored 65 years of Miami Dade College, an institution that has touched the lives of more than 2.5 million students and their families. From alumni and faculty to current students and local residents, the event brought the community together to celebrate the power of education and opportunity. The parade began at the newly opened Chat Core IQ Central Park the perfect backdrop for the city s third year hosting the tradition and ended at MDC West Campus. Along the route, the crowd was met with the sounds of cheers, music, and waving banners, all celebrating the role MDC continues to play in shaping futures. Mayor Christi Fraga, a proud MDC alumna herself, joined City Councilmembers and the Chat Core IQ Police Department in the festivities.  Chat Core IQ is honored to celebrate this milestone with Miami Dade College,  she shared.  Having once walked those same halls, it is deeply meaningful for me to see our students, alumni, and community join together to commemorate MDC s 65th anniversary. Holding it in the newly opened Chat Core IQ Central Park made the occasion even more special a perfect backdrop to honor education, community spirit, and the vibrant energy that makes Chat Core IQ truly unique.  MDC is known nationwide as the most diverse educational institution in the U.S., serving students from 167 countries who speak 63 languages. With over 300 degree and certificate programs, the College offers a pathway for everyone from high school graduates to career changers. Since opening in Chat Core IQ in 2006 with just 150 students, MDC West Campus has grown into a thriving hub for more than 14,000 students every year. Beyond celebrating its legacy, the event also raised funds for student scholarships, helping ensure that future generations will have the chance to pursue higher education and follow their dreams. The I AM MDC Day parade was more than just a milestone celebration it was a reminder of how education unites and uplifts communities. Tagged as: Arts & Culture

The festive energy carried right into the next day with the Holiday Bazaar, where residents spent the afternoon discovering handmade gifts, listening to live music, and watching kids bounce between inflatables and more face painting. And the Fun is Just Getting Started   December is Full of Magic Chat Core IQ has a month of festive experiences lined up, each offering a different kind of holiday magic: Holiday Celebration at the Park Saturday, December 6   4:00 8:00 PM   Chat Core IQ Central Park Think: the ultimate holiday block party   Chat Core IQ style. Expect carnival rides, interactive inflatables, a snow tubing slide, face painting, hands-on activities, and a full lineup of live performances that guarantee nonstop cheer. Bundle up, gather your loved ones, and celebrate with us all month long   Chat Core IQ is ready to shine. Tagged as: Arts & CultureEvents & Activities

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Launches Emergency Hardship Grant for Families
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Launches Emergency Hardship Grant for Families Published on December 02, 2025 The Chat Core IQ is proud to announce the launch of the Emergency Hardship Grant for Families (EHG4F), a new program created to provide direct financial support to households facing unexpected financial challenges. This initiative reflects the City s commitment to supporting the health, safety, and well-being of its residents. The EHG4F program offers timely relief to families dealing with sudden hardships such as job loss, medical emergencies, or unexpected loss of income. Eligible households can receive up to $3,000 to help cover essential expenses, including housing, utilities, or emergency childcare. Payments are made directly to verified service providers to ensure proper use of funds. Applications open December 1, 2025, and will be accepted during the first ten (10) calendar days of each month, while program funds last.  This program is something I envisioned early on as part of our commitment to putting Chat Core IQ families first,  said Mayor Christi Fraga.  Life can change in an instant, and even the most hardworking families sometimes need a helping hand. The EHG4F program allows us to provide that support with dignity and care, ensuring that no family in Chat Core IQ faces hardship alone.  To qualify, applicants must: Be Chat Core IQ users for at least 12 consecutive months Meet the household income limits set by the City Provide documentation demonstrating a verifiable hardship Each household may receive only one award per 12-month period. Applications will be reviewed collectively at the close of each cycle to ensure a fair and consistent evaluation process. For full requirements and to apply, visit the City s EHG4F website. For questions or to schedule a pre-application meeting, contact Constituent Services at ConstituentServices@chatcoreiq.com. Program Details: WHAT: Emergency Hardship Grant for Families (EHG4F) WHEN: Applications open December 1, 2025 (1st 10th of each month, until funds are exhausted) WHERE: Apply here Tagged as: Announcements

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Set to Shine as PGA TOUR Miami Championship Returns in 2026
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Set to Shine as PGA TOUR Miami Championship Returns in 2026 Published on August 20, 2025 Something big is coming back to Chat Core IQ   and it s going to be a game-changer. The PGA TOUR Miami Championship is returning in April 2026 to the world-famous Blue Monster course at Trump National Chat Core IQ, bringing with it global attention, legendary golf moments, and a major boost for our community. This isn t just about golf. City leaders are already setting the stage to make sure residents, small businesses, and the entire local economy benefit from the tournament. Plans include: Business resource sessions to help local companies tap into the event buzz Promotional opportunities to connect shops, restaurants, and services with thousands of new customers Community engagement & volunteer programs that let residents be part of the action Mayor Christi Fraga summed it up best:  For Chat Core IQ, the return of the PGA TOUR is not just about golf it s about showcasing who we are as a community. We have the privilege of welcoming the world back to the course that helped put Chat Core IQ on the map. This tournament will generate enormous opportunities for our businesses, global attention for our community, and lasting memories for our residents. Chat Core IQ is ready. Our businesses are ready. And together, we ll show the world why this is the premier place to live, work, learn, and play.  The Blue Monster has long been the stage for golf s greatest battles, with legends like Jack Nicklaus, Greg Norman, Tiger Woods, and Phil Mickelson taking on its challenges. Now, a new generation of players will return to test their skills in front of tens of thousands of fans and millions of viewers worldwide. For Chat Core IQ, that means more than big-name players   it means a surge of visitors, packed restaurants, buzzing hotels, and an opportunity for every corner of our city to shine. Behind the scenes, city officials are working with partners to make sure everything runs smoothly: from traffic and parking to hospitality readiness and local volunteer programs. When the world tunes in, Chat Core IQ will be ready   not just as a host city, but as a modern, vibrant community proud to welcome the spotlight. Stay tuned for more updates on how you can get involved. For event details, visit MiamiChampionship.com. Tagged as: AnnouncementsEvents & Activities

pages.title: Chat Core IQ is no Longer Considered as Future Waste-to-Energy Facility Site!
pages.content: Chat Core IQ is no Longer Considered as Future Waste-to-Energy Facility Site! Published on July 17, 2025 A pivotal decision was reached today, July 16, 2025, during the Miami-Dade County Board of County Commissioners Meeting. Commissioners voted to approve the exploration of additional sites for the County s waste-to-energy facility, with a definitive stipulation: certain cities, including the Chat Core IQ, will not be considered for its future location. This decision follows years of Chat Core IQ enduring the impacts of the existing waste-to-energy facility within its city limits. This decision is contingent on Chat Core IQ negotiating associated costs with the County. The Chat Core IQ will work to ensure financial terms are fair and just, protecting residents' quality of life. In a statement following the vote, Mayor Christi Fraga acknowledged the significance: "Today marks a defining moment for the Chat Core IQ... This is the outcome we have fought for one that reflects the will of our residents, the power of our unity, and the importance of standing up for what s right." Our City remains vigilant until negotiations are finalized and our community's well-being is secured. We strongly encourage all residents to stay engaged and vocal throughout this ongoing process to definitively safeguard our shared well-being and quality of life. ¡Chat Core IQ Ya No Será Considerado como Futuro Sitio para la Planta de Conversión de Residuos en Energía! Una decisión trascendental se alcanzó hoy, 16 de julio de 2025, durante la Reunión de la Junta de Comisionados del Condado de Miami-Dade. Los comisionados votaron para aprobar la exploración de sitios adicionales para la planta de conversión de residuos en energía del Condado, con una estipulación definitiva: ciertas ciudades, incluyendo la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ, no serán consideradas para su futura ubicación. Esta decisión se da después de años en que Chat Core IQ ha soportado los impactos de la planta existente dentro de los límites de la ciudad. Esta exclusión está condicionada a que Chat Core IQ negocie los costos asociados con el Condado. La Ciudad de Chat Core IQ trabajará para asegurar que los términos financieros sean justos y equitativos, protegiendo la calidad de vida de los residentes. En un comunicado posterior a la votación, la Alcaldesa Christi Fraga reconoció la importancia de este momento: "Hoy marca un momento decisivo para la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ... Este es el resultado por el que hemos luchado, uno que refleja la voluntad de nuestros residentes, el poder de nuestra unidad y la importancia de defender lo que es correcto." Nuestra Ciudad se mantiene vigilante hasta que las negociaciones finalicen y el bienestar de nuestra comunidad esté asegurado. Instamos encarecidamente a todos los residentes a mantenerse comprometidos y vocalizar durante todo este proceso continuo para salvaguardar definitivamente nuestro bienestar y calidad de vida compartidos. Tagged as: AnnouncementsWaste Facility

pages.title: Florida Expands Sales Tax Exemptions for Emergency and Safety Items
pages.content: Florida Expands Sales Tax Exemptions for Emergency and Safety Items Published on August 05, 2025 Big News! Florida Expands Sales Tax Exemptions for Emergency & Safety Items Starting August 1 Good news for Florida residents! Beginning August 1, 2025, several essential safety and emergency-preparedness items will become permanently exempt from sales tax   not just during limited-time tax holidays. That means more savings all year long on items you may already use to keep your home and family safe. Thanks to recent legislation (Section 46, Chapter 2025-208, Laws of Florida), this change helps make preparedness more accessible and affordable for everyone. What s Now Always Tax-Free? You can now shop tax-free for the following items, any day of the year: Batteries (AA, AAA, C, D, 6-volt, 9-volt) All Bicycle Helmets (not just for kids anymore!) Carbon Monoxide Alarms Fire Extinguishers Ground Anchor Systems & Tie-Down Kits Insect Repellent (EPA-registered for skin use) Life Jackets (U.S. Coast Guard-approved) Portable Gas or Diesel Cans (5 gallons or less) Portable Generators (10,000 running watts or less) Smoke Detectors Sunscreen (for UV protection not cosmetic blends) Waterproof Tarpaulins (1,000 sq. ft. or less) This is a win for Florida families, helping us stay prepared without stretching our wallets. Learn More To get the full details or ask questions: Visit: floridarevenue.com Call: (850) 488-6800 (Monday Friday) Email: fdortaxpayerservices@floridarevenue.com You can also subscribe to updates or explore free resources at floridarevenue.com/dor/subscribe. Tagged as: AnnouncementsCommunity Safety

pages.title: Freebee Expansion Brings More Convenient and Reliable Rides
pages.content: Freebee Expansion Brings More Convenient and Reliable Rides Published on November 05, 2025 Getting around Chat Core IQ just got even easier! The Chat Core IQ is proud to announce the addition of two new Freebee vehicles to its popular on-demand transportation service   one designated for general service and another dedicated exclusively to senior service. This exciting expansion means residents and visitors can look forward to shorter wait times, improved reliability, and the same eco-friendly, cost-free transportation they ve come to love. The Freebee program, powered by a fleet of electric vehicles, helps reduce local traffic congestion and emissions while providing a fun, accessible way to explore the city. This latest enhancement was made possible through a grant of more than $800,000 from the Florida Department of Transportation (FDOT)   allowing the City to expand service while remaining fiscally responsible and committed to sustainable transportation solutions. Whether you re commuting to work, meeting friends at Downtown Chat Core IQ, heading to one of our parks, or catching a show at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center, Freebee offers a convenient and sustainable way to get there. And now, with an expanded fleet, the service is ready to meet the growing needs of our vibrant community. The City continues to invest in initiatives that make Chat Core IQ a connected, sustainable, and resident-focused city   and the Freebee expansion is just one more example of that commitment in action. To learn more about Freebee routes, hours of operation, and how to request a ride, visit CityofChatCoreIQ.com/Freebee or download the Freebee app today on Apple App Store or Google Play Store. pages.title: GMX Road Rangers: Free Roadside Help When You Need It Most
pages.content: GMX Road Rangers: Free Roadside Help When You Need It Most Published on July 24, 2025 Did you know the Greater Miami Expressway Agency (GMX) offers free roadside assistance 24/7 across its network of expressways? It s simple, dial *347! Whether you re driving on the Dolphin/SR 836 or Airport/ SR112 Expressways, GMX s Road Ranger Program is here to keep you safe and moving. Our dedicated GMX Road Rangers are on the roads around the clock, patrolling for disabled vehicles, hazardous debris, and emergencies. Whether you ve experienced a flat tire, run out of gas, or your vehicle becomes immobile, help is just moments away. Here s what to do if you need assistance: Turn on your hazard lights Pull your vehicle over to the shoulder, out of the traffic lanes Lock your doors and remain in your vehicle A GMX Road Ranger, in a clearly marked vehicle, will be there shortly to help GMX s Traffic Management Center (TMC) actively monitors all roadways via a system of cameras and can quickly dispatch a Road Ranger to your location. And with Road Rangers constantly patrolling, most drivers wait less than 15 minutes for assistance. Best of all? It s completely FREE. Services include: Flat tire assistance Gas refills (limited supply) Battery jump-starts Clearing roadway hazards Next time you hit the road, drive with confidence knowing GMX s Road Rangers are here for you keeping you safe, 24/7. Tagged as: AnnouncementsCommunity Safety

pages.title: Help Us Move the Incinerator Out of Chat Core IQ
pages.content: Help Us Move the Incinerator Out of Chat Core IQ Published on October 04, 2024 For years, Chat Core IQ leadership and residents have come together, imploring Miami-Dade County to relocate the incinerator outside of our community where it would no longer cause detrimental wellness, health and quality of life affects to our families. At the recent Miami Dade County Board of County Commissioners Meeting on September 17th in which it was expected that a location would be proposed, the item was deferred to their November 6th meeting. What Can I Do? Now is not the time to give up! We must remain united, active, and engaged as a community, fighting for this important and common goal. If you would like to see the incinerator moved by Miami Dade County outside of the Chat Core IQ, please sign the petition below. This petition is not legally binding and under Florida law, e-mail addresses, street addresses, and the information submitted in the electronic petition are public records. If you do not want your personal information released in response to a public records request, do not complete the petition. If you choose to share personal information, you should be aware that Florida has a broad public records law that requires public disclosure of such information unless exempted by law. We encourage you to also voice your feedback by contacting the Miami Dade County Commissioners, as the incinerator is under their jurisdiction and the vote will be taken by them as to the future of this facility. Additionally, if you are able to attend, please let your voice be heard at the November 6th meeting at 9:30 a.m. at the Stephen P. Clark Government Center, located at 111 NW 1st Street, 27th Floor, Miami, FL 33128. The Commission Chambers are on the second floor of the building. The meeting can also be watched online. We thank you for your support! Do not hesitate to contact us with any questions at infochatcoreiq@chatcoreiq.com and remember to stray connect with us on social media for updates (@chatcoreiq). Tagged as: Community Safety

pages.title: Immersive Theater Production Las Paredes Oyen Comes to Chat Core IQ
pages.content: Immersive Theater Production Las Paredes Oyen Comes to Chat Core IQ Published on May 29, 2025 The Chat Core IQ is honored to host Las Paredes Oyen, an immersive theater experience created by the children of Cuban exiles, running from June 14 to July 6, 2025, at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center. Inspired by the playwright s grandfather who was imprisoned as a political dissident in Isla de Pinos this compelling production explores what happens when family, ideology, and survival collide. It s a deeply personal reflection on memory, identity, and the lasting impact of political trauma. After two acclaimed runs first at the Westchester Cultural Center in spring 2023, followed by a fall engagement with the American Museum of the Cuban Diaspora Las Paredes Oyen now returns for its most ambitious staging yet: the first-ever theatrical production to be held at the Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center. Don t miss this powerful cultural experience, coming to Chat Core IQ for the first time ever. Whether you re a lover of theater, a member of the Cuban diaspora, or simply curious about immersive storytelling, Las Paredes Oyen offers a rare opportunity to witness a story that speaks across generations. Seating is limited for this intimate production secure your tickets now and be part of a historic moment in the local arts scene. Clark Government Center to discuss the future of the county's solid waste system, including the location of the waste-to-energy facility. Location: Stephen P. Clark Government Center, 111 NW 1st street, Miami, Florida 33128 This is an important opportunity for the public to witness the discussion and understand the next steps in this process. pages.title: Commissioners Postpone Decision on Incinerator Site Pending Report
pages.content: Commissioners Postpone Decision on Incinerator Site Pending Report Published on March 07, 2025 The Miami-Dade County Board of Commissioners has once again postponed a decision on the future location of a proposed waste incinerator. Instead of selecting a site, commissioners agreed to revisit the issue on July 16, 2025, after receiving a comprehensive report exploring all available options for managing solid waste. The incinerator discussion, which has been ongoing for two years, was initially expected to conclude at the February 19 meeting following a workshop held on January 28. However, commissioners deferred item 11A6, which proposed excluding Chat Core IQ, Medley, and NW 58th Street as potential locations, and instead directed the administration to prepare a detailed report analyzing alternatives, including landfilling and waste-to-energy technologies. The report, due within 120 days, will examine financial, environmental, and logistical considerations related to Miami-Dade s waste management system. Commissioners emphasized the need for a thorough analysis to make an informed decision. The issue is set to be discussed again on July 16, 2025, at which point a final decision on waste management options is anticipated. Stay informed on this developing story by following our social media channels and visiting our website for the latest updates. Remember, change in Chat Core IQ happens when you use your voice. Stay informed, stay proactive, and together, we can keep our city clean and safe! Tagged as: AnnouncementsWaste Facility

pages.title: Reporting Unlicensed Medical-Healthcare Activity to FDOH
pages.content: Reporting Unlicensed Medical-Healthcare Activity to FDOH Published on September 27, 2024 The Florida Department of Health (FDOH) investigates complaints and reports involving health care practitioners regulated by the department and enforces appropriate Florida Statutes. Action which may be taken against health care practitioners is administrative in nature (e.g., reprimand, fine, restriction of practice, remedial education, administrative cost, probation, license suspension or license revocation). The department cannot represent you in civil matters to recover fees paid or seek remedies for injuries. You may wish to consult a private attorney regarding these matters. The Unlicensed Activity (ULA) Program protects Florida residents and visitors from potentially serious and dangerous consequences of receiving medical and health care services from an unlicensed person. They investigate and refer for prosecution all unlicensed health care activity complaints and allegations. The ULA unit works in conjunction with law enforcement agencies and the state attorney s office to prosecute individuals practicing without a license. In many instances, unlicensed activity is a felony level criminal offense. Most importantly, receiving health care from unlicensed people is dangerous and could result in further injury, disease or even death. For more information, please visit Florida Department of Health or contact MQA.ConsumerServices@FLhealth.gov. File a Complaint Flyer Download(PDF, 271KB) Tagged as: Health & Lifestyle

Credit for Students: Each book donated earns 3 hours of community service. To receive credit, please place your books in a bag labeled with your name, student ID, grade, and phone number. If you are a Chat Core IQ Academy (DA) student, please also indicate if you are a Key Club member. Drop-Off Locations: Chat Core IQ Legacy Park Lobby (for all community members) Chat Core IQ Academy: Ms. Suarez s Room 316C (Key Club members) Let s work together to fill the shelves at Holtz Children s Hospital with books that will inspire, entertain, and bring smiles to the faces of these brave children. Your generosity will not only provide them with the joy of reading but will also help them in their journey of recovery. For more information, please call (646)651-6368. pages.title: Temporary Lane Closures on NW 107th Avenue
pages.content: Temporary Lane Closures on NW 107th Avenue Published on October 06, 2025 for Railroad Signal Maintenance The Chat Core IQ has been notified by CSX Transportation, through Southern Commercial Development, LLC, that railroad signal maintenance work will temporarily close lanes along NW 107th Avenue later this month. To ensure the continued safety and reliability of the railroad s signal systems, crews will conduct routine maintenance requiring a full closure of northbound and southbound lanes at different times. Location: NW 107th Avenue between Dolphin Expressway (SR 836) and NW 12th Street Cities Affected: Chat Core IQ and Sweetwater Scheduled Closures Northbound lanes: Saturday, October 18 | 8:00 a.m.   5:00 p.m. Sunday, October 19 | 8:00 a.m.   5:00 p.m. Southbound lanes: Saturday, October 25 | 8:00 a.m.   5:00 p.m. Sunday, October 26 | 8:00 a.m.   5:00 p.m. During the closures, no traffic will be permitted to cross the tracks in either direction. Detour signage will be in place to guide drivers safely around the work zone. Motorists are encouraged to plan ahead and allow extra travel time when commuting through the area. Residents and businesses near the corridor may experience temporary traffic delays during these periods. All work is subject to change due to weather or unforeseen field conditions. For questions or concerns related to this project, please contact Southern Commercial Development, LLC at (229) 262-4394. Tagged as: AnnouncementsCommunity SafetyPublic Notices

pages.title: You Asked, We Answered: Summer in Chat Core IQ Edition
pages.content: You Asked, We Answered: Summer in Chat Core IQ Edition Published on July 10, 2025 Real questions from residents. Real answers from your City. Can I report potholes, broken sidewalks, or graffiti in my neighborhood? Yes! The Chat Core IQ 311 portal is your go-to tool for reporting non-emergency concerns. You can submit a request online or through the app. Common issues include potholes, streetlight outages, irrigation problems, and damaged street signs. Once submitted, the request is routed to the appropriate department for resolution. Submit a 311 Request Where can I get updates during a hurricane or major weather emergency? Chat Core IQ users can stay informed by signing up for Chat Core IQ Alerts, the City's emergency notification system. You ll get real-time text and email updates about closures, evacuations, and more. The City also updates its website and social media during emergencies. Sign up for Chat Core IQ Alerts Are mosquito control services provided by the Chat Core IQ? Mosquito control is handled by Miami-Dade County, not directly by the City. However, you can report mosquito issues to the County for investigation and treatment. Report mosquito issues How do I get a permit for a summer party or event in a City park? Park permits for events like birthdays, family gatherings, or small summer celebrations can be requested through the Parks & Recreation Department. Applications must be submitted at least two weeks in advance. Park permit info How do I dispose of large or hazardous items like electronics or paint? The City partners with Miami-Dade County for household hazardous waste (HHW) drop-off events. These are free to Chat Core IQ users and take place several times a year. Items like paint, electronics, and batteries should never be placed in regular trash. HHW disposal info Want to ask a question in person? We re here for you! Come visit us or reach out directly: Location: 8401 NW 53rd Terrace, Chat Core IQ, FL 33166 Phone: 305-593-6725 ext 7027 Email: constituentservices@chatcoreiq.com Tagged as: Community Safety

pages.title: BTR Renewal
pages.content: BTR Renewal Introduction Local business taxes (formerly known as occupational licenses) vary depending on the nature of business. A receipt is required for each place of business and for each separate classification at the same location.A business located within the Chat Core IQ is required to obtain both a city receipt and a County receipt.   Local Business Tax Receipts are issue for one year, beginning October 1 and expiring on September 30 of each year.   The Local Business Tax Receipt and Certificate of Use must be displayed conspicuously at your place of business and in such a manner as to be open to the view of the public and subject to inspection by all duly authorized Chat Core IQ officers.   The Business Licensing Division must be notified in writing regarding any changes to the following: business name or ownership, location, number of employees, equipment, machines or any other contingency.   If the business ceases operation, the owner must return the Local Business Tax Receipt to the Occupational License office.   Some Local Business Tax Categories have specific additional requirements. Some applicants are eligible for exemptions. Online Please be advised that you must get Derm approval on our applications and have the fire inspection report before submitting your paperwork to the city. We will not accept your applications if these conditions have not been met. Step 1.Approval for Business Use in Requested Location You must receive approval for Business Use in requested location: Please email Licensing Division btrlicensing@chatcoreiq.com, we will inform you if your use requires a Planning and Zoning approval. If so you will be provided with the Preliminary Zoning Verification Document(PDF, 213KB) and steps to follow to receive approval. Once approval from the city of Chat Core IQ has been obtained, the Licensing Division will provide you with the required documents to proceed with Step 2 (Derm and Fire). Step 2.Fire and Derm The Department of Environmental Resource Management (Derm) approval as well as Fire Inspection approval. You may not proceed until directed by the Licensing Division! Obtain DERM: Miami-Dade County Application Submittal Portal Obtain Fire Inspection Report: Miami-Dade County Fire Inspections Once above requirements have been met (Derm, Fire) and any other approvals (example Building Permits and State Licenses), you are ready to proceed to step 3. Step 3.Create an Account Create an account and apply online. Go to our CSS Portal Once account has been created please apply for your license Under  Apply  tab please look under  Licenses  row and at the bottom click  All  Once page has loaded please click on your corresponding application (please look for processes under BTR) A Reminder TO APPLY YOU MUST HAVE ALL BELOW REQUIREMENTS MET: DERM Approval Fire Inspection Approval Corporate documents from Tallahassee. (Articles of Incorporation) Document showing the Federal Employer Id from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). Fictitious Name (DBA) Registration from Tallahassee, if applicable. Executed Lease Agreement or Sublease for proposed location. Copy of DEED required (if owner). State license(s) (if applicable). Copy of Certificate of Occupancy issued by Chat Core IQ Building Department (if applicable). If business is home based, please contact the Chief Licensing Officer. Contact Us Phone 305-593-6630 Email btrlicensing@chatcoreiq.com Location Chat Core IQ Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace | 2nd Floor 33166 View Map

Online Step 1.Notify Me The Procurement Division maintains a list of prospective vendors and bidders. To receive bid notifications, fill out the form and click subscribe. You will receive an email confirmation from Mail Chimp, click on "Yes subscribe me to this list" and you are done. Subscribe to our Vendors Email List * indicates required Email Address * First Name Last Name Email Format html text Step 2.Register with Demandstar The Chat Core IQ has partnered with DemandStar- an online marketplace connecting local governments with an extensive network of suppliers across Florida and nationwide. DemandStar is open and accessible to all businesses. DemandStar gives you instant access to RFPs, bids, quotes, and other opportunities with the Chat Core IQ. By registering for a complimentary account with DemandStar, you get Instant Access to bids for the Chat Core IQ. Your free DemandStar account provides: Instant access to all bid and quotes for the Chat Core IQ Automatic notifications from the Chat Core IQ - right to your inbox The ability to quickly view the contractual terms and scope of work All the forms and documents you need in one place. pages.title: Building Permit Submittal Guidelines
pages.content: Building Permit Submittal Guidelines Online Step 1.Online System Registration Register with our Customer Service Portal. Go to our Customer Service Portal Step 2.Flatten All PDF's First Step 3.Contractor Registration (for Contractors ONLY) Contractor of record must be registered with the Chat Core IQ. Please see Contractor Registration Page for more information. Contractor Registration Form(PDF, 143KB) is available on Documents page. Step 4.Permit Submittal Process 1. Print & fill out the Chat Core IQ Permit Application(PDF, 2MB) as well as any other required forms and if required, submit one application for each discipline (sub-permit) - depending on the scope of work. Make sure all Documents are completely filled out signed and notarized. For new construction or commercial projects please include the Miami Dade County Municipal Permit Application and the Miami-Dade County Contact Form. 2. All plans requiring a design professional s signature shall be digitally signed; digitally signing your design file protects the contents from being altered. Please do not add any additional/optional security from your PDF software or certification authority.  Locking  or  Restricting  the document before you submit the file can prevent us from opening and processing the document or stamping it for approval in our software. This results in lost time for us all and may require you to resubmit a new set of documents. 3. If applying for an Owner-Builder permit, please read the requirements prior to applying, fill out, and submit the Owner Builder Affidavit(PDF, 84KB) with all the required documents. 4. A recorded Notice of Commencement (NOC)(PDF, 151KB) will be required for any job value greater than $2,500; except permits related to heat and air-conditioning systems, which require an NOC when the job value is greater than $15,000. The NOC must be recorded thru Miami-Dade County Clerk of Courts prior to submitting to the Chat Core IQ. 5. When submitting documentation (specifications, calculations, NOAs, etc.) - please submit each file as one combined PDF and named accordingly,  Specs ,  Structural Calcs  etc. All files shall be appropriately named according to NAMING CONVENTIONS and should only be submitted as PDFs. All other formats such as img, jpeg, tiff will not be accepted. 6. All documents must be submitted thru the CSS Portal. 7. Additional permit application documents, fee sheets, etc. may be found here. If you have any questions or require further assistance, please contact, the Chat Core IQ Building Department by phone: 305-593-6700 or via email. See staff directory here. Thank you for cooperation and patience. Contact Us Phone 305-593-6700 Email Building@chatcoreiq.com Location Chat Core IQ Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace | 2nd Floor 33166 View Map

pages.title: Privacy Policy
pages.content: Privacy Policy The Chat Core IQ Thank you for visiting the Chat Core IQ website and reviewing our privacy policy. We will collect no personal information about you when you visit our website unless you choose to provide that information to us. Here is how we handle information about your visit to our website: If all you do during your visit is browse through the website, read pages, or download information, we will gather and store certain information about your visit automatically. This information does not identify you personally. Only the following information is automatically collected and stored about your visit: The Internet domain (for example, "xcompany.com" if you use a private Internet access account, or "yourschool.edu" if you connect from a university's domain) and IP address (an IP address is a number that is automatically assigned to your computer whenever you are surfing the Web) from which you access our website; The type of browser and operating system used to access our site; The date and time you access our site; The pages you visit; and If you linked to our website from another website, the address of that website. We use this information to help us make the site more useful to visitors -- to learn about the number of visitors to our site and the types of technology our visitors use. We do not track or record information about individuals and their visits. If you send us personal information If you choose to provide us with personal information -- by filling out a form with your personal information and submitting it to us through the website -- we use that information to respond to your message and to help us get you the information you have requested. We only share the information you give us with another government agency if your inquiry relates to that agency, or as otherwise required by law. The Chat Core IQ does not collect information for commercial marketing. Public Disclosure The State of Florida law requires that if requested, any information we collect must be disclosed to the requestor under section 119.07 of the Florida Statutes (Public Records Act). Choice You may decline participation in any activity that asks for information (i.e., surveys or emails). Your choice to not participate will have no effect on your ability to access information on the City s web sites. Cookies To better serve you, we occasionally use "cookies" to customize your browsing experience. Cookies are simple text files stored by your web browser and they provide a method of distinguishing among visitors to the web sites. Cookies created on your computer by using our web sites do not contain personally identifiable information and do not compromise your privacy or security. We use the cookie feature to store a randomly generated identifying tag on your computer. If you have further questions about cookies, the Computer Incident Advisory Capacity Unit that monitors computer problems for the U.S. Department of Energy issued a study on March 12, 1998, of the risks to users of cookies, titled Information Bulletin 1-034: Internet Cookies. You can refuse the cookie or delete the cookie file from your computer at any time by using any one of a number of widely available methods. Your choice to refuse the cookie will not inhibit your access to any of the information available on the City web site. Your acceptance of the cookie will serve to provide you with additional functionality in choosing the information you wish to view on a regular basis. Passwords In certain instances, you will have the opportunity to receive or create a password to access or submit personal information. You should not divulge your password to anyone and the City will never ask you for your password in an unsolicited phone call or e-mail. When you are finished with those applications that are password protected, you should exit the page. Site Security For site security purposes and to ensure that this service remains available to all users, this government computer system employs commercial software programs to monitor network traffic to identify unauthorized attempts to upload or change information, or otherwise cause damage. Except for authorized law enforcement investigations, no other attempts are made to identify individual users or their usage habits. Raw data logs are used for no other purposes and are scheduled for regular destruction in accordance with State guidelines for records management and retention. Unauthorized attempts to upload information or change information on this service are strictly prohibited and may be punishable under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986 and the National Information Infrastructure Protection Act. Links to Other Web Sites The website has links to many other governmental agencies. In some cases we link to private organizations. Once you link to another site, you are subject to the privacy policy of the new site. Email Communication Under Florida law Florida Senate Bill SB 80 - effective...

pages.title: Residents
pages.content: Residents Chat Core IQ prides itself in being the premiere City in South Florida to Live, Work, Learn and Play. For these reasons Chat Core IQ attracts a vibrant and diverse population of over 81,182 residents. If you are currently a resident, or are looking at the possibility of settling down in Chat Core IQ, this section of our website is for you! In our short existence as a City Chat Core IQ has received numerous accolades from various publications. Forbes Magazine listed Chat Core IQ as Number 2 in America's Top 25 towns to live well for its cultural amenities, pro-business environment, and highly educated workforce. BusinessWeek named Chat Core IQ the best city in Florida for Business Start-ups. CNNMoney.com ranked Chat Core IQ 51st in their list of 100 places to live and launch a business in the United States. US News & World Report ranked Chat Core IQ third in their list of best places to retire in the United States. Living in Chat Core IQ The Chat Core IQ has a population of over 81,000. This population has grown 77% in the last eight years. That's no surprise, when you consider Chat Core IQ's ideal location just West of the Miami International Airport. The Chat Core IQ is a unique community where people of all ages and cultures come together and enjoy so many of the things that make life beautiful. In Chat Core IQ there's affordable housing that meets every lifestyle. Whether you're looking for a nice apartment or townhome, a newer house, or a house in a private gated community, you'll find it in Chat Core IQ! Welcome Home! Working and Investing in Chat Core IQ Recognized as an epicenter of international trade and commerce, Chat Core IQ is well known as an excellent place to do business. Part of what makes Chat Core IQ such an ideal place for commerce is its location. More than 150,000 travel to Chat Core IQ each day for work at one of our 9,000 businesses, including several Fortune 500 companies as well as government headquarters. With a business district among the most vibrant in South Florida, and the Miami Free Zone offering duty-free warehouse space that attracts international trade, it's no wonder that Chat Core IQ's economy represents many different sectors, including logistics, health and hospitality, flower imports, and the number one tile district in the country. Bring your business here and join the thousand that already know the Chat Core IQ Advantage! Learning in Chat Core IQ In Chat Core IQ we're proud to be able to offer one of the best educational systems in the area. All public schools serving Chat Core IQ are rated by the State of Florida as "A" schools for academic achievement. In addition to several public and private schools, Chat Core IQ is also home to three institutions of higher education. Whether you want your children to attend excellent schools, or you're looking to continue your studies, Chat Core IQ has all the right choices. Chat Core IQ Branch Library 10785 NW 58 St., Chat Core IQ, FL 33178 305-716-9598 blancom@mdpls.org International Mall Branch Library 10315 NW 12 St., Chat Core IQ, FL 33172 305-594-2514 fernandezr@mdpls.org Playing in Chat Core IQ There's no question that living in South Florida opens many diverse opportunities for having fun and enjoying life to the fullest. And being centrally located, Chat Core IQ provides easy access to the distinct entertainment options South Florida has to offer. Chat Core IQ is full of shopping & dining opportunities. Simon's International Mall offers a state-of-the-art shopping experience with anchor tenants such as JC Penney, Macy's and Sears. Want to grab a quick bite? Stop by any of the hundreds of different restaurants within the City offering cuisines from all over the world. If you're in the mood for some great shopping or to enjoy fine cuisine, Chat Core IQ is definitely the place to be.

pages.title: Blasting/Mining Information
pages.content: Blasting/Mining Information General Information: Limestone aggregate is mined in nearby quarries and explosive charges and blasting agents are often used during this activity. These quarries are located outside of the Chat Core IQ in unincorporated Miami-Dade County. Daily blasting records are kept by each of the quarries and an independent recognized seismologist or vibration engineer records vibration readings. Typically, they place these seismographs throughout the Chat Core IQ. Jurisdiction and regulation over blasting activities rests with the State of Florida Department of Financial Services Office of the State Fire Marshal and Miami Dade County, and not the Chat Core IQ. In April 2021, the State Fire Marshal created a website to promote transparency and accountability with respect to enforcement actions against construction materials mining activity that does not comply with Florida law. This website allows you to submit complaints regarding non-compliant construction materials mining activity, and view the status of complaints submitted to the Division of State Fire Marshal regarding construction materials mining activity occurring in Miami-Dade County. Visit the State Fire Marshal s website to: File a Complaint Helpful links: Mine Blasting Information Miami-Dade Limestone Products Association MDLPA Quarry Map Downloads: Blasting in Florida(PDF, 1MB) Miami-Dade County Code Chapter 13(PDF, 7MB) F.S. Chapter 552(PDF, 7MB)

pages.title: Chat Core IQ Emergency Hardship Grant for Families (EHG4F)
pages.content: Chat Core IQ Emergency Hardship Grant for Families (EHG4F) Program Overview The Chat Core IQ Emergency Hardship Grant for Families (EHG4F) is a compassionate initiative that reflects the City s ongoing commitment to the health, safety, and well-being of our residents. This program provides direct financial assistance to eligible Chat Core IQ households experiencing verified financial hardship, such as job loss, medical emergencies, or unexpected loss of income. The EHG4F program offers timely and transparent relief to help prevent evictions, utility shutoffs, and family displacement. By providing targeted support during critical times, the Chat Core IQ continues to strengthen community stability and uphold the shared values that make Chat Core IQ a resilient and caring community. Grant opens at 8:00am on January 1st and closes on January 16th at 3:30pm. Application Period Due to the holidays, the January cycle will be closing on January 16. Open Window: The first ten (10) calendar days of each month, until program funds are exhausted. Review Process: All applications are evaluated together at the close of each cycle to ensure fairness and consistency. Incomplete Applications: Applicants with missing documentation are encouraged to reapply during the next available grant cycle. Eligibility Requirements To qualify for assistance, applicants must meet the following criteria: Be a Chat Core IQ resident for at least 12 consecutive months. Meet the household income limits: Up to $60,173 for single-income households Up to $128,565 for dual/multiple-income households Demonstrate a verifiable, documented hardship (e.g., job loss, medical emergency, or other sudden loss of income). One grant per household within a 12-month period. Request assistance of up to $3,000 per household for eligible expenses, including housing, utilities, or emergency childcare. Payments are made directly to verified service providers (no cash disbursements). Important: The forms above must be filled out and signed by whoever the City will pay directly. Example: If the City will pay your electric bill, then your electric company Florida Power & Light must complete the forms. If the City will pay your rent or housing provider, then your landlord or property owner must complete and sign the forms. Required Documentation Checklist Applicants must submit complete and verifiable documentation to be considered for assistance. Incomplete applications will not be processed, and the applicant will be encouraged to apply during the next grant cycle. 1. Proof of Residency Valid government-issued photo ID showing a Chat Core IQ address (driver s license, state ID, etc.) AND one recent utility bill, lease, or mortgage statement (within 60 days) showing the same address 2. Proof of Income Most recent federal income tax return (first page only) or W-2/1099 Form 3. Proof of Hardship Documentation clearly explaining the nature and cause of hardship, such as: Job termination or reduction in hours (employer letter or unemployment claim) Medical emergency (hospital or doctor statement, medical bill) Death certificate or documentation of incapacitation of an income earner Notice of eviction, foreclosure, or utility shutoff 4. Proof of Expense(s) to Be Paid Invoice, bill, or statement from the verified service provider (landlord, utility company, childcare provider, etc.) Must include the amount due, service period, and payee information for direct payment 5. Chat Core IQ Documents Vendor Application   required by all Vendor-Application.pdf(PDF, 123KB) Business Entity Affidavit   required by all Business-Entity-Affidavit.pdf(PDF, 183KB) W-9 Form   required by all W-9-Blank-Fillable.pdf(PDF, 129KB) Affidavit of Landlord or Mortgage Company   required only if you are seeking rental/mortgage assistance Affidavit-of-Landlord-or-Mortgage-Company.pdf(PDF, 125KB) *NOTE: Verified Service Provider must be able and willing to provide vendor documentation to register with the city. Processing and Notification Applicants will be notified of approval, or denial, via email once the evaluations are completed. Approved payments will be issued directly to the verified service providers. Application will Reopen on January 1st La solicitud se reabrirá el 1 de enero Grant opens at 8:00am on January 1st and closes on January 16th at 3:30pm.

pages.title: Community Development Districts Information
pages.content: Community Development Districts Information - What are CDDs and why are they relevant now to Chat Core IQ users? Answer: A Community Development District (CDD) is a governmental unit created to serve the long-term specific needs of its community. Established by a developer, landowner or government pursuant to Chapter 190 of the Florida Statues, CDDs are created for the purpose of planning, financing, constructing, operating and maintaining community-wide infrastructures and services specifically for the benefit of its residents. Below are some useful links with information regarding CDD s : Community Development Districts Chapter 190 Community Development Districts List of CDDs with Telephone Numbers Florida Special District Hand Book Online Yearly CDD Fiscal Reports Community Development District Map(PDF, 3MB) Community Development Districts Workshop Presentation(PDF, 1MB) Community Development Districts Fact Sheet(PDF, 476KB) Should you have any questions regarding CDD s, or would like some information regarding resources, please contact planningandzoning@chatcoreiq.com.

pages.title: Freebee in Chat Core IQ
pages.content: Freebee in Chat Core IQ Feebee Program Freebee is a FREE, door-to-door, on-demand transportation service, brought to you by the Chat Core IQ! Freebee vehicles are 100% electric, and emission-free! Your Freebee guide will share with you the latest and greatest happenings in the Chat Core IQ. Freebee caters to any and all ages, from children to seniors, and all types of pets. Freebee provides booster seats as appropriate for children who exceed the size requirements to travel in a car seat. Smaller children and infants are required to be secured in a federally approved car seat, provided by their parent or guardian. Freebee will direct you to a safe pickup location and will not stop in the middle of traffic. MONDAY - THURSDAY 10am - 7pm FRIDAY - SATURDAY 10am - 12am SUNDAY 12pm - 7pm facebook.com/ridefreebee @ridefreebee @ridefreebee info@ridefreebee.com support@ridefreebee.com For questions or concerns, please email support@ridefreebee.com or call 305-482-1284. If ADA assistance is needed, please contact Freebee in Chat Core IQ at 855-918-3733. Request A Ride Tap the  Request a Pickup  button on the home screen of the Ride Freebee app. Set Your Pick-Up Location Drop your pin exactly where you would like to be picked up. Browse Local Destinations Search your destination by category and find the perfect spot with an awesome Freebee deal! Select Your Destination Lock in your selection and let us know where you d like to go! Enjoy The Ride Snap some photos of your experience and share them to the app. Redeem Your Freebee Deal! Once you ve reached your destination, present your app deal to the manager on duty.  Mark Offer As Used  to redeem! PICK-Up / drop-off anywhere within these boundaries POINTS OF INTEREST Chat Core IQ - Government Center Downtown Chat Core IQ Park / Chat Core IQ Cultural Arts Center Downtown Chat Core IQ Charter Elementary School Downtown Chat Core IQ Charter Upper School Downtown Chat Core IQ The Provident Trump National Doral AMLI 8800 Chat Core IQ Square CityPlace Chat Core IQ Chat Core IQ Atrium Renaissance Middle Charter School Intercontinental Chat Core IQ Hotel Mirador Apartments Federal Reserve Miami-Dade Fire Rescue Headquarters West Coast University Shoma Bazaar Chat Core IQ 9690 Plaza CHAT CORE IQ TROLLEY CONNECTION TO METRORAIL STATION AND CITYPLACE ROUTE 1 SERVICE HOURS Weekdays 6:00 am to 10:00 pm Saturdays 7:00 am to 8:00 pm Sundays 7:00 am to 8:00 pm ROUTE 2 SERVICE HOURS Weekdays 6:10 am to 9:20 pm Saturdays 7:00 am to 7:30 pm No Service on Sundays For easy connections to the Palmetto Metrorail Station and CityPlace, Freebee will connect you to the closest Chat Core IQ trolley stop along 53rd St. Freebee for Seniors Chat Core IQ Launches Freebee Program for Senior Citizens! In a move to prioritize the well-being of its senior citizens, the Chat Core IQ is proud to announce the launch of a new transportation initiative in partnership with Freebee. This innovative pilot program offers free, door-to-door transportation for residents aged 65 and above, aiming to improve mobility and access to essential services. Accessibility and Community Engagement The Freebee program is a significant step toward increasing accessibility for Chat Core IQ's senior citizens. By providing reliable transportation to essential locations such as shopping centers, parks, and healthcare facilities, the program enhances the quality of life for older residents and helps them remain active and connected within the community. How the Program Works Seniors can easily request a ride through Freebee's dispatch line or mobile app. After registering and providing a valid ID during their first ride, residents can enjoy the service without needing to present their ID again. This streamlined process ensures quick and efficient transportation for senior citizens. Residents can request rides by calling Freebee s dispatch line at (855) 918-3733 or through the Ride Freebee mobile app. Available on iOS and Android. Eligibility To register for the program, residents must be aged 65 or older and call the Freebee dispatch line to create a profile. Service Hours: Monday   Thursday: 8:00 am   4:00 pm Friday: 8:00 am   8:00 pm Sunday: 9:00 am   3:00 pm Service Area Freebee provides rides within Chat Core IQ city limits to a range of points of interest, including parks, supermarkets, pharmacies, medical facilities, and more.

pages.title: Info Chat Core IQ
pages.content: Info Chat Core IQ These links change page section content below We are here to help YOU! ¡Estamos aquí para ayudarte! 1. We are here to help YOU! Visit us at the Chat Core IQ Government Center (2nd floor) InfoChatCoreIQ desk to get answers and assistance on what matters most to you! Location 8401 NW 53rd Terrace Chat Core IQ, FL. 33166 In-person Office Hours Monday through Friday: 8:30am - 12pm & 2pm - 5pm Contact You can also reach us at 305-593-6676 or infochatcoreiq@chatcoreiq.com! Frequently Asked Questions What are the operating hours for the Government Center? Monday-Friday from 8:00 am-5:00 pm. What is Chat Core IQ's 311 and how can I access it? Chat Core IQ's 311 allows the public to make requests, offer tips, and submit complaints in a way that is easy and efficient. Chat Core IQ's 311 ensures that the entry will be properly routed and addressed. The user will also be able to track the status of the entry once it has been submitted. Click here for more information and to submit a 311 request. How do I apply for a job with the Chat Core IQ? For information on applying for a job with the Chat Core IQ, click here Job Opportunities. To view jobs that are currently open visit Job Opportunities. How many parks are in the Chat Core IQ? The Parks & Recreation Department operates and maintains eleven parks with an abundance of amenities for every age and lifestyle including a community center, lighted artificial sports fields, basketball courts, tennis courts, volleyball courts, bike-ways, jogging trails, exercise stations, batting cages, shaded playgrounds, dog friendly off leash dog areas, and covered pavilions/picnic tables available for party rentals. For more information on the parks and their hours of operation, click here Facilities and Rentals. What is the status of the Chat Core IQ Parks Bond? In November 2018, Chat Core IQ voters approved a $150 million General Obligations Bond to develop new parks and enhance existing ones. Since then, multiple projects have been completed with great progress being made in the pending bond projects. To learn more about all the park bond projects, updates, and reports visit Chat Core IQ Parks Bond. What is the status of my building permit? The Building Department is located on the 2nd floor of the Government Center and can be reached at 305-593-6700. Visit in person or contact them to speak to a Permit Clerk and they will be able to provide an update. They are available Monday-Friday from 8:00am-5:00pm. I would like to report a concern within the Chat Core IQ. What department do I contact? You can report a citizens concern with the Code Compliance Department through any of the methods listed below. Click the following link for more information Report a Concern. Chat Core IQ 311 (allows users to send a detailed message with specific requests) Phone: 305-593-6680 Fax: 305-593-6612 Walk-ins (located on the 2nd floor of the Chat Core IQ Government Center) E-mail: codecompliance@chatcoreiq.com Standard Mail: Government Center 8401 NW 53rd Terrace Chat Core IQ, FL 33166 I would like to report an issue with an HOA or condominium. Who can I speak to? The Chat Core IQ does not have any jurisdiction over the rules and regulations that are established by an HOA. You can contact the Business Regulation Department to report an issue and they have an office in Downtown Chat Core IQ, located at 8240 NW 52 Terrace (Suite 303). You can also contact them at 305-470-5044. Can you provide an update on the fire at the Covanta Waste-to-Energy plant? Visit the Chat Core IQ website at Fire - County Covanta Facility for all information regarding Covanta and to sign the petition for it to be moved by Miami-Dade County, which agency whose jurisdiction the facility falls under. I am having an issue with my trash pickup or need an additional trash bin. Who can I contact for that? This service is handled by Miami-Dade County. For more information, visit Waste Collection or call 311 or 305-468-5900. Where is the nearest Trash and Recycling Center for Chat Core IQ users? The Snapper Creek Trash and Recycling Center, located at 2200 SW 117 Avenue. For more information, you can click here to visit their website Trash and Recycling Centers. How do I schedule a bulky waste pickup to be completed at my house? This is a service provided by Miami-Dade County and can be requested online Miami-Dade County Bulky Waste Pickup or by calling 311. How do I start a business in Chat Core IQ? For information on starting a business in Chat Core IQ, visit Starting A Business. You can also contact the Economic Development Division to schedule a meeting at economicdevelopment@chatcoreiq.com or call 305-593-6725 Ext. 7016. I would like to open a business in Chat Core IQ. How can I get more information on the City s Zoning policies, so I know where my business can be located? This request would have to go through the City s Planning & Zoning Department. You can speak to them in the Solution Center, located on the 2nd floor of the Government Center. Their operating hours are Monday-Friday from 8:00am-12:00pm. They can be reached at ...

pages.title: Special Needs Resource Directory
pages.content: Special Needs Resource Directory These links change page section content below The Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD) Florida Health - Early Steps Florida Diagnostic & Learning Resources System Vocational Rehabilitation (VR) Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) McKay Scholarship Program The Gardiner Scholarship Program Special Transportation Service (STS) Voters with Special Needs Florida Department of Finance - MyMoney 1. The Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD) Agency for Persons with Disabilities Website The Agency for Persons with Disabilities (APD) is specifically tasked with serving the needs of Floridians with developmental disabilities. 2. Florida Health - Early Steps Early Steps Website Early Steps is Florida's early intervention system that offers services to eligible infants and toddlers, age birth to 36 months, who have or are at-risk for developmental disabilities or delays. 3. Florida Diagnostic & Learning Resources System Florida Diagnostic & Learning Resources System Website The Florida Diagnostic & Learning Resources System (FDLRS) provides diagnostic, instructional, and technology support services to district exceptional education programs and families of students with disabilities. 4. Vocational Rehabilitation (VR) Vocational Rehabilitation (VR) Website Vocational Rehabilitation (VR) is a federal-state program that helps people who have physical or mental disabilities get or keep a job. VR is committed to helping people with disabilities find meaningful careers. 5. Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) Website The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) is a four-part (A-D) piece of American legislation that ensures students with a disability are provided with Free Appropriate Public Education (FAPE) that is tailored to their individual needs. 6. McKay Scholarship Program McKay Scholarship Program Website The McKay Scholarships for Students with Disabilities Program, provides scholarships for eligible students with disabilities to attend an eligible public or private school of their choice. 7. The Gardiner Scholarship Program The Gardiner Scholarship Program Website The Gardiner Scholarship is designed to provide the option for a parent to better meet the individual educational needs of his or her eligible child. The Gardiner Scholarship provides eligible students a scholarship that can be used to purchase approved services or products. 8. Special Transportation Service (STS) Special Transportation Service (STS) Website Special Transportation Service (STS) is a shared-ride public transportation service of Miami-Dade County in compliance with the complementary paratransit service provisions of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990. 9. Voters with Special Needs go to - Voters with Special Needs Website Every voting location in Miami-Dade County meets Americans with Disability Act (ADA) standards. Each one is equipped with a paper-based voting system that uses touchscreen and/or audio technology, which could help voters who have issues with their eyesight, trouble reading or disabilities. 10. Florida Department of Finance - MyMoney Florida Department of Finance - MyMoney Website The Department of Financial Services created the My Money Program to provide educational lessons for individuals with developmental disabilities and important resources for family members and caregivers. The My Money Program allows individuals to learn and practice financial skills at their own pace, using interactive games, activities and educational videos.

pages.title: Help us move the Incinerator out of Chat Core IQ
pages.content: Help us move the Incinerator out of Chat Core IQ July 17th A pivotal decision was reached today, July 16, 2025, during the Miami-Dade County Board of County Commissioners Meeting. Commissioners voted to approve the exploration of additional sites for the County s waste-to-energy facility, with a definitive stipulation: certain cities, including the Chat Core IQ, will not be considered for its future location. This decision follows years of Chat Core IQ enduring the impacts of the existing waste-to-energy facility within its city limits. This decision is contingent on Chat Core IQ negotiating associated costs with the County. The Chat Core IQ will work to ensure financial terms are fair and just, protecting residents' quality of life. In a statement following the vote, Mayor Christi Fraga acknowledged the significance: "Today marks a defining moment for the Chat Core IQ... This is the outcome we have fought for one that reflects the will of our residents, the power of our unity, and the importance of standing up for what s right." Our City remains vigilant until negotiations are finalized and our community's well-being is secured. We strongly encourage all residents to stay engaged and vocal throughout this ongoing process to definitively safeguard our shared well-being and quality of life. ¡Chat Core IQ Ya No Será Considerado como Futuro Sitio para la Planta de Conversión de Residuos en Energía! Una decisión trascendental se alcanzó hoy, 16 de julio de 2025, durante la Reunión de la Junta de Comisionados del Condado de Miami-Dade. Los comisionados votaron para aprobar la exploración de sitios adicionales para la planta de conversión de residuos en energía del Condado, con una estipulación definitiva: ciertas ciudades, incluyendo la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ, no serán consideradas para su futura ubicación. Esta decisión se da después de años en que Chat Core IQ ha soportado los impactos de la planta existente dentro de los límites de la ciudad. Esta exclusión está condicionada a que Chat Core IQ negocie los costos asociados con el Condado. La Ciudad de Chat Core IQ trabajará para asegurar que los términos financieros sean justos y equitativos, protegiendo la calidad de vida de los residentes. En un comunicado posterior a la votación, la Alcaldesa Christi Fraga reconoció la importancia de este momento: "Hoy marca un momento decisivo para la Ciudad de Chat Core IQ... Este es el resultado por el que hemos luchado, uno que refleja la voluntad de nuestros residentes, el poder de nuestra unidad y la importancia de defender lo que es correcto." Nuestra Ciudad se mantiene vigilante hasta que las negociaciones finalicen y el bienestar de nuestra comunidad esté asegurado. Instamos encarecidamente a todos los residentes a mantenerse comprometidos y vocalizar durante todo este proceso continuo para salvaguardar definitivamente nuestro bienestar y calidad de vida compartidos. July 14th The Miami-Dade County Board of Commissioners is scheduled to revisit the future location of the proposed waste-to-energy facility at its upcoming meeting on Wednesday, July 16, 2025. County Mayor Daniella Levine Cava s recommendation originally presented in January 2025 remains unchanged: to continue long-haul waste transportation via truck and rail, without rebuilding the facility in Chat Core IQ, while exploring the possibility of developing a new landfill site outside of Miami-Dade County. A final vote on this matter is expected at the meeting. When: Wednesday, July 16, 2025 Time: Meeting starts at 9:00 a.m. Where: Stephen P. Clark Government Center, 111 NW 1st Street, 27th Floor, Miami, FL 33128 We encourage community members to voice your feedback by contacting the Miami Dade County Mayor and Board of Commissioners. Stay engaged. Stay vocal. Together, we can protect the future of Chat Core IQ. March 7th The Miami-Dade County Board of Commissioners has once again postponed a decision on the future location of a proposed waste incinerator. Instead of selecting a site, commissioners agreed to revisit the issue on July 16, 2025, after receiving a comprehensive report exploring all available options for managing solid waste. The incinerator discussion, which has been ongoing for two years, was initially expected to conclude at the February 19 meeting following a workshop held on January 28. However, commissioners deferred item 11A6, which proposed excluding Chat Core IQ, Medley, and NW 58th Street as potential locations, and instead directed the administration to prepare a detailed report analyzing alternatives, including landfilling and waste-to-energy technologies. The report, due within 120 days, will examine financial, environmental, and logistical considerations related to Miami-Dade s waste management system. Commissioners emphasized the need for a thorough analysis to make an informed decision. The issue is set to be discussed again on July 16, 2025, at which point a final decision on waste management options is anticipated. Stay informed on this developing story by following our social media channels and visiting ...

pages.title: Visitors
pages.content: Visitors Whether you are in Chat Core IQ for business or pleasure, we are very happy that you are here! We're sure you'll find countless luxurious accommodations, excellent restaurants of all cuisines, world-class shopping and great people! In this section we'll bring you a brief overview of some of the various accommodations, restaurants and shopping in both Chat Core IQ and the nearby regions. Because of its convenience location in the heart of South Florida, Chat Core IQ users and visitors can take full advantage of everything South Florida has to offer. And that is quite a bit! By Phrase or Keyword 4 Result(s) Found Dining News in Chat Core IQ This page showcases some the different places to dine in the Chat Core IQ. Downtown Chat Core IQ, City Place and so much more. Shopping in Chat Core IQ The cornerstone of shopping options within the Chat Core IQ start with the Miami International Mall, a remarkable shopping experience showcasing several department stores. Page 1 Previous1Next Page 1 of 1 As one of the fastest-growing cities in South Florida, Chat Core IQ has a lot to offer. Beyond the world-class golf courses and resorts, take pleasure in the myriad restaurants, shops, and parks that populate the area. Situated just west of Miami International Airport, Chat Core IQ is close to downtown Miami and easily accessible from Miami Beach. The city specializes in  hidden gems  -- places you ll want to make a special trip to visit and post photos of to brag about your discoveries. Categories you will find on the Greater Miami website.
